-- | <a>SslConfiguration</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>scCertificate</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>scChain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>scPrivateKey</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
sslConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> SslConfiguration

-- | The contents of the certificate's domain.crt file.
scCertificate :: Lens' SslConfiguration Text

-- | Optional. Can be used to specify an intermediate certificate authority
--   key or client authentication.
scChain :: Lens' SslConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The private key; the contents of the certificate's domain.kex file.
scPrivateKey :: Lens' SslConfiguration Text

-- | The command exit code.

-- | The ID of the instance where the command was executed.

-- | The array's size.

-- | The stack ID.

-- | The volume type, standard or PIOPS.

elbEc2InstanceIds :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer [Text]

elbElasticLoadBalancerName :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the layer that the instance is attached to.

-- | The instance's AWS region.

-- | The ID of the stack that the instance is associated with.

--   RDS instance. AWS OpsWorks attempts to discover the instance only
--   once. If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, you must deregister the
--   instance and then register it again.

data BlockDeviceMapping

-- | <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>bdmDeviceName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>bdmEbs</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>EbsBlockDevice</a></li>
--   <li><a>bdmNoDevice</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>bdmVirtualName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
blockDeviceMapping :: BlockDeviceMapping

-- | The device name that is exposed to the instance, such as '/dev/sdh'.
--   For the root device, you can use the explicit device name or you can
--   set this parameter to <tt>ROOT_DEVICE</tt> and AWS OpsWorks will
--   provide the correct device name.
bdmDeviceName :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | An <tt>EBSBlockDevice</tt> that defines how to configure an Amazon EBS
--   volume when the instance is launched.
bdmEbs :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe EbsBlockDevice)

-- | Suppresses the specified device included in the AMI's block device
--   mapping.
bdmNoDevice :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | The virtual device name. For more information, see
--   <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a>.
bdmVirtualName :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe Text)

data LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration

-- | <a>LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lbascDownScaling</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>AutoScalingThresholds</a></li>

--   <li><a>lbascLayerId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lbascUpScaling</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>AutoScalingThresholds</a></li>
--   </ul>
loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration :: LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration

-- | An <a>AutoScalingThresholds</a> object that describes the downscaling
--   configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks reduces the
--   number of instances.
lbascDownScaling :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe AutoScalingThresholds)

-- | Whether load-based auto scaling is enabled for the layer.
lbascEnable :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | The layer ID.
lbascLayerId :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | An <a>AutoScalingThresholds</a> object that describes the upscaling
--   configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks increases the
--   number of instances.
lbascUpScaling :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe AutoScalingThresholds)

-- | <a>Volume</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--

--   <li><a>vInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>vIops</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>vMountPoint</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>vName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>vRaidArrayId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>vRegion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>vSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>vStatus</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>vVolumeId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>vVolumeType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
volume :: Volume

-- | The volume Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a>.
vAvailabilityZone :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

vDevice :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon EC2 volume ID.
vEc2VolumeId :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance ID.
vInstanceId :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
vIops :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Int)

-- | The volume mount point. For example "<i>dev</i>sdh".
vMountPoint :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

vName :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

vStatus :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume type, standard or PIOPS.
vVolumeType :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

data AutoScalingThresholds

-- | <a>AutoScalingThresholds</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>astAlarms</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>astCpuThreshold</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Double</a></li>
--   <li><a>astIgnoreMetricsTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>astInstanceCount</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>astLoadThreshold</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Double</a></li>
--   <li><a>astMemoryThreshold</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Double</a></li>
--   <li><a>astThresholdsWaitTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Natural</a></li>
--   </ul>
autoScalingThresholds :: AutoScalingThresholds

-- | Custom Cloudwatch auto scaling alarms, to be used as thresholds. This
--   parameter takes a list of up to five alarm names, which are case
--   sensitive and must be in the same region as the stack.
--   
--   To use custom alarms, you must update your service role to allow
--   'cloudwatch:DescribeAlarms'. You can either have AWS OpsWorks update
--   the role for you when you first use this feature or you can edit the
--   role manually. For more information, see <a>Allowing AWS OpsWorks to
--   Act on Your Behalf</a>.
astAlarms :: Lens' AutoScalingThresholds [Text]

-- | The CPU utilization threshold, as a percent of the available CPU.
astCpuThreshold :: Lens' AutoScalingThresholds (Maybe Double)

-- | The amount of time (in minutes) after a scaling event occurs that AWS
--   OpsWorks should ignore metrics and suppress additional scaling events.
--   For example, AWS OpsWorks adds new instances following an upscaling
--   event but the instances won't start reducing the load until they have
--   been booted and configured. There is no point in raising additional
--   scaling events during that operation, which typically takes several
--   minutes. <tt>IgnoreMetricsTime</tt> allows you to direct AWS OpsWorks
--   to suppress scaling events long enough to get the new instances
--   online.
astIgnoreMetricsTime :: Lens' AutoScalingThresholds (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of instances to add or remove when the load exceeds a
--   threshold.
astInstanceCount :: Lens' AutoScalingThresholds (Maybe Int)

-- | The load threshold. For more information about how load is computed,
--   see <a>Load(computing)</a>.
astLoadThreshold :: Lens' AutoScalingThresholds (Maybe Double)

-- | The memory utilization threshold, as a percent of the available
--   memory.
astMemoryThreshold :: Lens' AutoScalingThresholds (Maybe Double)

-- | The amount of time, in minutes, that the load must exceed a threshold
--   before more instances are added or removed.
astThresholdsWaitTime :: Lens' AutoScalingThresholds (Maybe Natural)
data App

-- | <a>App</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>appAppId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>appAppSource</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Source</a></li>
--   <li><a>appAttributes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a>
--   <a>AppAttributesKeys</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>appCreatedAt</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>appDataSources</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>DataSource</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>appDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>appDomains</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>appEnableSsl</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>appEnvironment</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>EnvironmentVariable</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>appName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>appShortname</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>appSslConfiguration</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>SslConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>appStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>appType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>AppType</a></li>
--   </ul>
app :: App

-- | The app ID.
appAppId :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | A <a>Source</a> object that describes the app repository.
appAppSource :: Lens' App (Maybe Source)

-- | The stack attributes.
appAttributes :: Lens' App (HashMap AppAttributesKeys Text)

-- | When the app was created.
appCreatedAt :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | The app's data sources.
appDataSources :: Lens' App [DataSource]

-- | A description of the app.
appDescription :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | The app vhost settings with multiple domains separated by commas. For
--   example: ''www.example.com, example.com''
appDomains :: Lens' App [Text]

-- | Whether to enable SSL for the app.
appEnableSsl :: Lens' App (Maybe Bool)

-- | An array of <a>EnvironmentVariable</a> objects that specify
--   environment variables to be associated with the app. After you deploy
--   the app, these variables are defined on the associated app server
--   instances. For more information, see <a>Environment Variables</a>.
--   
--   There is no specific limit on the number of environment variables.
--   However, the size of the associated data structure - which includes
--   the variables' names, values, and protected flag values - cannot
--   exceed 10 KB (10240 Bytes). This limit should accommodate most if not
--   all use cases, but if you do exceed it, you will cause an exception
--   (API) with an "Environment: is too large (maximum is 10KB)" message.
appEnvironment :: Lens' App [EnvironmentVariable]

-- | The app name.
appName :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | The app's short name.
appShortname :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | An <a>SslConfiguration</a> object with the SSL configuration.
appSslConfiguration :: Lens' App (Maybe SslConfiguration)

-- | The app stack ID.
appStackId :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | The app type.
appType :: Lens' App (Maybe AppType)
data ElasticIp

-- | <a>ElasticIp</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>eiDomain</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>eiInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>eiIp</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>eiName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>eiRegion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
elasticIp :: ElasticIp

-- | The domain.
eiDomain :: Lens' ElasticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the instance that the address is attached to.
eiInstanceId :: Lens' ElasticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address.
eiIp :: Lens' ElasticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The name.
eiName :: Lens' ElasticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS region. For more information, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a>.
eiRegion :: Lens' ElasticIp (Maybe Text)
data ShutdownEventConfiguration

-- | <a>ShutdownEventConfiguration</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>secDelayUntilElbConnectionsDrained</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>secExecutionTimeout</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   </ul>
shutdownEventConfiguration :: ShutdownEventConfiguration

-- | Whether to enable Elastic Load Balancing connection draining. For more
--   information, see <a>Connection Draining</a>
secDelayUntilElbConnectionsDrained :: Lens' ShutdownEventConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | The time, in seconds, that AWS OpsWorks will wait after triggering a
--   Shutdown event before shutting down an instance.
secExecutionTimeout :: Lens' ShutdownEventConfiguration (Maybe Int)
data InstanceIdentity

-- | <a>InstanceIdentity</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>iiDocument</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iiSignature</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
instanceIdentity :: InstanceIdentity

-- | A JSON document that contains the metadata.
iiDocument :: Lens' InstanceIdentity (Maybe Text)

-- | A signature that can be used to verify the document's accuracy and
--   authenticity.
iiSignature :: Lens' InstanceIdentity (Maybe Text)
data UserProfile

-- | <a>UserProfile</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>upAllowSelfManagement</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>upIamUserArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>upName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>upSshPublicKey</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>upSshUsername</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
userProfile :: UserProfile

-- | Whether users can specify their own SSH public key through the My
--   Settings page. For more information, see <a>Managing User
--   Permissions</a>.
upAllowSelfManagement :: Lens' UserProfile (Maybe Bool)

-- | The user's IAM ARN.
upIamUserArn :: Lens' UserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's name.
upName :: Lens' UserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's SSH public key.
upSshPublicKey :: Lens' UserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's SSH user name.
upSshUsername :: Lens' UserProfile (Maybe Text)
data AutoScalingType

-- | load
Load :: AutoScalingType

-- | timer
Timer :: AutoScalingType
data Source

-- | <a>Source</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>sPassword</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sRevision</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sSshKey</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>SourceType</a></li>
--   <li><a>sUrl</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sUsername</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
source :: Source

-- | When included in a request, the parameter depends on the repository
--   type.
--   
--   For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Password</tt> to the appropriate IAM
--   secret access key. For HTTP bundles and Subversion repositories, set
--   <tt>Password</tt> to the password. For more information on how to
--   safely handle IAM credentials, see
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-access-keys-best-practices.html</a>.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks returns '*****FILTERED*****' instead of the
--   actual value.
sPassword :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | The application's version. AWS OpsWorks enables you to easily deploy
--   new versions of an application. One of the simplest approaches is to
--   have branches or revisions in your repository that represent different
--   versions that can potentially be deployed.
sRevision :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | In requests, the repository's SSH key.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks returns '*****FILTERED*****' instead of the
--   actual value.
sSshKey :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | The repository type.
sType :: Lens' Source (Maybe SourceType)

-- | The source URL.
sUrl :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | This parameter depends on the repository type.
--   
--   For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Username</tt> to the appropriate IAM
--   access key ID. For HTTP bundles, Git repositories, and Subversion
--   repositories, set <tt>Username</tt> to the user name.
sUsername :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)
data DataSource

-- | <a>DataSource</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dsArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dsDatabaseName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dsType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
dataSource :: DataSource

-- | The data source's ARN.
dsArn :: Lens' DataSource (Maybe Text)

-- | The database name.
dsDatabaseName :: Lens' DataSource (Maybe Text)

-- | The data source's type, <tt>AutoSelectOpsworksMysqlInstance</tt>,
--   <tt>OpsworksMysqlInstance</tt> , or <a>RdsDbInstance</a>.
dsType :: Lens' DataSource (Maybe Text)
data Architecture

-- | i386
I386 :: Architecture

-- | x86_64
X8664 :: Architecture
data StackConfigurationManager

-- | <a>StackConfigurationManager</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>scmName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>scmVersion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
stackConfigurationManager :: StackConfigurationManager

-- | The name. This parameter must be set to <a>Chef</a>.
scmName :: Lens' StackConfigurationManager (Maybe Text)

-- | The Chef version. This parameter must be set to 0.9, 11.4, or 11.10.
--   The default value is 11.4.
scmVersion :: Lens' StackConfigurationManager (Maybe Text)
data EbsBlockDevice

-- | <a>EbsBlockDevice</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ebdDeleteOnTermination</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>ebdIops</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>ebdSnapshotId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ebdVolumeSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>ebdVolumeType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>VolumeType</a></li>
--   </ul>
ebsBlockDevice :: EbsBlockDevice

-- | Whether the volume is deleted on instance termination.
ebdDeleteOnTermination :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume
--   supports. For more information, see <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
ebdIops :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Int)

-- | The snapshot ID.
ebdSnapshotId :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume size, in GiB. For more information, see
--   <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
ebdVolumeSize :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Int)

-- | The volume type. <tt>gp2</tt> for General Purpose (SSD) volumes,
--   <tt>io1</tt> for Provisioned IOPS (SSD) volumes, and <tt>standard</tt>
--   for Magnetic volumes.
ebdVolumeType :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe VolumeType)
data LayerAttributesKeys

-- | BundlerVersion
BundlerVersion :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | EnableHaproxyStats
EnableHaproxyStats :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | GangliaPassword
GangliaPassword :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | GangliaUrl
GangliaUrl :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | GangliaUser
GangliaUser :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | HaproxyHealthCheckMethod
HaproxyHealthCheckMethod :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | HaproxyHealthCheckUrl
HaproxyHealthCheckUrl :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | HaproxyStatsPassword
HaproxyStatsPassword :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | HaproxyStatsUrl
HaproxyStatsUrl :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | HaproxyStatsUser
HaproxyStatsUser :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | JavaAppServer
JavaAppServer :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | JavaAppServerVersion
JavaAppServerVersion :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | Jvm
Jvm :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | JvmOptions
JvmOptions :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | JvmVersion
JvmVersion :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | ManageBundler
ManageBundler :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | MemcachedMemory
MemcachedMemory :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | MysqlRootPassword
MysqlRootPassword :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | MysqlRootPasswordUbiquitous
MysqlRootPasswordUbiquitous :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | NodejsVersion
NodejsVersion :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | PassengerVersion
PassengerVersion :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | RailsStack
RailsStack :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | RubyVersion
RubyVersion :: LayerAttributesKeys

-- | RubygemsVersion
RubygemsVersion :: LayerAttributesKeys
data TemporaryCredential

-- | <a>TemporaryCredential</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>tcInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>tcPassword</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>tcUsername</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>tcValidForInMinutes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   </ul>
temporaryCredential :: TemporaryCredential

-- | The instance's AWS OpsWorks ID.
tcInstanceId :: Lens' TemporaryCredential (Maybe Text)

-- | The password.
tcPassword :: Lens' TemporaryCredential (Maybe Text)

-- | The user name.
tcUsername :: Lens' TemporaryCredential (Maybe Text)

-- | The length of time (in minutes) that the grant is valid. When the
--   grant expires, at the end of this period, the user will no longer be
--   able to use the credentials to log in. If they are logged in at the
--   time, they will be automatically logged out.
tcValidForInMinutes :: Lens' TemporaryCredential (Maybe Int)
data VolumeConfiguration

-- | <a>VolumeConfiguration</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>vcIops</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>vcMountPoint</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>vcNumberOfDisks</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>vcRaidLevel</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>vcSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>vcVolumeType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
volumeConfiguration :: Text -> Int -> Int -> VolumeConfiguration

-- | For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
vcIops :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | The volume mount point. For example "<i>dev</i>sdh".
vcMountPoint :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration Text

-- | The number of disks in the volume.
vcNumberOfDisks :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration Int

-- | The volume <a>RAID level</a>.
vcRaidLevel :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | The volume size.
vcSize :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration Int

-- | The volume type:
--   
--   <tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic <tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD)
--   <tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD)
vcVolumeType :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration (Maybe Text)
data VolumeType

-- | gp2
Gp2 :: VolumeType

-- | io1
Io1 :: VolumeType

-- | standard
Standard :: VolumeType
data ReportedOs

-- | <a>ReportedOs</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>roFamily</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>roName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>roVersion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
reportedOs :: ReportedOs

-- | The operating system family.
roFamily :: Lens' ReportedOs (Maybe Text)

-- | The operating system name.
roName :: Lens' ReportedOs (Maybe Text)

-- | The operating system version.
roVersion :: Lens' ReportedOs (Maybe Text)
data Permission

-- | <a>Permission</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>pAllowSsh</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>pAllowSudo</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>pIamUserArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pLevel</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
permission :: Permission

-- | Whether the user can use SSH.
pAllowSsh :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Bool)

-- | Whether the user can use sudo.
pAllowSudo :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
pIamUserArn :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's permission level, which must be the following:
--   
--   <tt>deny</tt> <a>show</a> <tt>deploy</tt> <tt>manage</tt>
--   <tt>iam_only</tt> For more information on the permissions associated
--   with these levels, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>
pLevel :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Text)

-- | A stack ID.
pStackId :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Text)
data EnvironmentVariable

-- | <a>EnvironmentVariable</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>evKey</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>evSecure</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>evValue</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
environmentVariable :: Text -> Text -> EnvironmentVariable

-- | (Required) The environment variable's name, which can consist of up to
--   64 characters and must be specified. The name can contain upper- and
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores (_), but it must start
--   with a letter or underscore.
evKey :: Lens' EnvironmentVariable Text

-- | (Optional) Whether the variable's value will be returned by the
--   <tt>DescribeApps</tt> action. To conceal an environment variable's
--   value, set <tt>Secure</tt> to <tt>true</tt>. <tt>DescribeApps</tt>
--   then returns '*****FILTERED*****' instead of the actual value. The
--   default value for <tt>Secure</tt> is <tt>false</tt>.
evSecure :: Lens' EnvironmentVariable (Maybe Bool)

-- | (Optional) The environment variable's value, which can be left empty.
--   If you specify a value, it can contain up to 256 characters, which
--   must all be printable.
evValue :: Lens' EnvironmentVariable Text
data Layer

-- | <a>Layer</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lAttributes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a>
--   <a>LayerAttributesKeys</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lAutoAssignElasticIps</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>lAutoAssignPublicIps</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>lCreatedAt</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lCustomInstanceProfileArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lCustomRecipes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Recipes</a></li>
--   <li><a>lCustomSecurityGroupIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>lDefaultRecipes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Recipes</a></li>
--   <li><a>lDefaultSecurityGroupNames</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>lEnableAutoHealing</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>lInstallUpdatesOnBoot</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>lLayerId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lLifecycleEventConfiguration</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>LifecycleEventConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>lName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lPackages</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>lShortname</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>LayerType</a></li>
--   <li><a>lUseEbsOptimizedInstances</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>lVolumeConfigurations</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>VolumeConfiguration</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
layer :: Layer

-- | The layer attributes.
--   
--   For the <a>HaproxyStatsPassword</a>, <a>MysqlRootPassword</a>, and
--   <a>GangliaPassword</a> attributes, AWS OpsWorks returns
--   '*****FILTERED*****' instead of the actual value
lAttributes :: Lens' Layer (HashMap LayerAttributesKeys Text)

-- | Whether to automatically assign an <a>Elastic IP address</a> to the
--   layer's instances. For more information, see <a>How to Edit a
--   Layer</a>.
lAutoAssignElasticIps :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | For stacks that are running in a VPC, whether to automatically assign
--   a public IP address to the layer's instances. For more information,
--   see <a>How toEdit a Layer</a>.
lAutoAssignPublicIps :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | Date when the layer was created.
lCreatedAt :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the default IAM profile to be used for the layer's EC2
--   instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
lCustomInstanceProfileArn :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | A <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt> object that specifies the layer's custom
--   recipes.
lCustomRecipes :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Recipes)

-- | An array containing the layer's custom security group IDs.
lCustomSecurityGroupIds :: Lens' Layer [Text]
lDefaultRecipes :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Recipes)

-- | An array containing the layer's security group names.
lDefaultSecurityGroupNames :: Lens' Layer [Text]

-- | Whether auto healing is disabled for the layer.
lEnableAutoHealing :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is
--   set to <tt>false</tt>, you must then update your instances manually by
--   using <tt>CreateDeployment</tt> to run the
--   <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack command or manually running
--   <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or 'apt-get' (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
lInstallUpdatesOnBoot :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The layer ID.
lLayerId :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | A <tt>LifeCycleEventConfiguration</tt> object that specifies the
--   Shutdown event configuration.
lLifecycleEventConfiguration :: Lens' Layer (Maybe LifecycleEventConfiguration)

-- | The layer name.
lName :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of <tt>Package</tt> objects that describe the layer's
--   packages.
lPackages :: Lens' Layer [Text]

-- | The layer short name.
lShortname :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | The layer stack ID.
lStackId :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | The layer type.
lType :: Lens' Layer (Maybe LayerType)

-- | Whether the layer uses Amazon EBS-optimized instances.
lUseEbsOptimizedInstances :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | A <tt>VolumeConfigurations</tt> object that describes the layer's
--   Amazon EBS volumes.
lVolumeConfigurations :: Lens' Layer [VolumeConfiguration]
data Recipes

-- | <a>Recipes</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rConfigure</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>rDeploy</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>rSetup</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>rShutdown</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>rUndeploy</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
recipes :: Recipes

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>configure</tt> event.
rConfigure :: Lens' Recipes [Text]

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>deploy</tt>
--   event.
rDeploy :: Lens' Recipes [Text]

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>setup</tt>
--   event.
rSetup :: Lens' Recipes [Text]

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>shutdown</tt> event.
rShutdown :: Lens' Recipes [Text]

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>undeploy</tt> event.
rUndeploy :: Lens' Recipes [Text]
data TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration

-- | <a>TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>tbascAutoScalingSchedule</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule</a></li>
--   <li><a>tbascInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
timeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration :: TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration

-- | A <a>WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule</a> object with the instance schedule.
tbascAutoScalingSchedule :: Lens' TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule)

-- | The instance ID.
tbascInstanceId :: Lens' TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe Text)
data SelfUserProfile

-- | <a>SelfUserProfile</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>supIamUserArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>supName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>supSshPublicKey</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>supSshUsername</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
selfUserProfile :: SelfUserProfile

-- | The user's IAM ARN.
supIamUserArn :: Lens' SelfUserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's name.
supName :: Lens' SelfUserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's SSH public key.
supSshPublicKey :: Lens' SelfUserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's SSH user name.
supSshUsername :: Lens' SelfUserProfile (Maybe Text)
data RootDeviceType

-- | ebs
Ebs :: RootDeviceType

-- | instance-store
InstanceStore :: RootDeviceType
data Stack

-- | <a>Stack</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>sArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sAttributes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a>
--   <a>StackAttributesKeys</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sChefConfiguration</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>ChefConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>sConfigurationManager</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>StackConfigurationManager</a></li>
--   <li><a>sCreatedAt</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sCustomCookbooksSource</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Source</a></li>
--   <li><a>sCustomJson</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sDefaultAvailabilityZone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sDefaultInstanceProfileArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sDefaultOs</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sDefaultRootDeviceType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>RootDeviceType</a></li>
--   <li><a>sDefaultSshKeyName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sDefaultSubnetId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sHostnameTheme</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sRegion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sServiceRoleArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sUseCustomCookbooks</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>sUseOpsworksSecurityGroups</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>sVpcId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
stack :: Stack

-- | The stack's ARN.
sArn :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's attributes.
sAttributes :: Lens' Stack (HashMap StackAttributesKeys Text)

-- | A <a>ChefConfiguration</a> object that specifies whether to enable
--   Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version. For more information, see
--   <a>Create a New Stack</a>.
sChefConfiguration :: Lens' Stack (Maybe ChefConfiguration)

-- | The configuration manager.
sConfigurationManager :: Lens' Stack (Maybe StackConfigurationManager)

-- | Date when the stack was created.
sCreatedAt :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)
sCustomCookbooksSource :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Source)

-- | A string that contains user-defined, custom JSON. It can be used to
--   override the corresponding default stack configuration JSON values or
--   to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the following format
--   and must escape characters such as '"'.:
--   
--   '"{"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2",...}"'
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the StackConfiguration Attributes</a>.
sCustomJson :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's default Availability Zone. For more information, see
--   <a>Regions andEndpoints</a>.
sDefaultAvailabilityZone :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the
--   stack's EC2 instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
sDefaultInstanceProfileArn :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's default operating system.
sDefaultOs :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The default root device type. This value is used by default for all
--   instances in the stack, but you can override it when you create an
--   instance. For more information, see <a>Storage for the Root
--   Device</a>.
sDefaultRootDeviceType :: Lens' Stack (Maybe RootDeviceType)

-- | A default Amazon EC2 key pair for the stack's instances. You can
--   override this value when you create or update an instance.
sDefaultSshKeyName :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The default subnet ID, if the stack is running in a VPC.
sDefaultSubnetId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores.
sHostnameTheme :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack name.
sName :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack AWS region, such as "us-east-1". For more information about
--   AWS regions, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
sRegion :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role.
sServiceRoleArn :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
sStackId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.
sUseCustomCookbooks :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Bool)

-- | Whether the stack automatically associates the AWS OpsWorks built-in
--   security groups with the stack's layers.
sUseOpsworksSecurityGroups :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Bool)

-- | The VPC ID, if the stack is running in a VPC.
sVpcId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)
data DeploymentCommand

-- | <a>DeploymentCommand</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dcArgs</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a> <a>Text</a>
--   [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dcName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>DeploymentCommandName</a></li>
--   </ul>
deploymentCommand :: DeploymentCommandName -> DeploymentCommand

-- | The arguments of those commands that take arguments. It should be set
--   to a JSON object with the following format:
--   
--   '{"arg_name1" : ["value1", "value2", ...], "arg_name2" :
--   ["value1","value2", ...], ...}'
--   
--   The <tt>update_dependencies</tt> command takes two arguments:
--   
--   <tt>upgrade_os_to</tt> - Specifies the desired Amazon Linux version
--   for instances whose OS you want to upgrade, such as 'Amazon Linux
--   2014.09'. You must also set the <tt>allow_reboot</tt> argument to
--   true. <tt>allow_reboot</tt> - Specifies whether to allow AWS OpsWorks
--   to reboot the instances if necessary, after installing the updates.
--   This argument can be set to either <tt>true</tt> or <tt>false</tt>.
--   The default value is <tt>false</tt>. For example, to upgrade an
--   instance to Amazon Linux 2014.09, set <tt>Args</tt> to the following.
--   
--   ' { "upgrade_os_to":["Amazon Linux 2014.09"], "allow_reboot":["true"]
--   } '
dcArgs :: Lens' DeploymentCommand (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | Specifies the operation. You can specify only one command.
--   
--   For stacks, the following commands are available:
--   
--   <tt>execute_recipes</tt>: Execute one or more recipes. To specify the
--   recipes, set an <tt>Args</tt> parameter named <a>recipes</a> to the
--   list of recipes to be executed. For example, to execute
--   'phpapp::appsetup', set <tt>Args</tt> to
--   '{"recipes":["phpapp::appsetup"]}'. <tt>install_dependencies</tt>:
--   Install the stack's dependencies. <tt>update_custom_cookbooks</tt>:
--   Update the stack's custom cookbooks. <tt>update_dependencies</tt>:
--   Update the stack's dependencies. The update_dependencies and
--   install_dependencies commands are supported only for Linux instances.
--   You can run the commands successfully on Windows instances, but they
--   do nothing. For apps, the following commands are available:
--   
--   <tt>deploy</tt>: Deploy an app. Ruby on Rails apps have an optional
--   <tt>Args</tt> parameter named <tt>migrate</tt>. Set <tt>Args</tt> to
--   {"migrate":["true"]} to migrate the database. The default setting is
--   {"migrate":["false"]}. <tt>rollback</tt> Roll the app back to the
--   previous version. When you update an app, AWS OpsWorks stores the
--   previous version, up to a maximum of five versions. You can use this
--   command to roll an app back as many as four versions. <tt>start</tt>:
--   Start the app's web or application server. <a>stop</a>: Stop the app's
--   web or application server. <tt>restart</tt>: Restart the app's web or
--   application server. <tt>undeploy</tt>: Undeploy the app.
dcName :: Lens' DeploymentCommand DeploymentCommandName
data WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule

-- | <a>WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>wassFriday</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a> <a>Text</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>wassMonday</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a> <a>Text</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>wassSaturday</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a> <a>Text</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>wassSunday</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a> <a>Text</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>wassThursday</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a> <a>Text</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>wassTuesday</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a> <a>Text</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>wassWednesday</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a> <a>Text</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule

-- | The schedule for Friday.
wassFriday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Monday.
wassMonday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Saturday.
wassSaturday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Sunday.
wassSunday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Thursday.
wassThursday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Tuesday.
wassTuesday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Wednesday.
wassWednesday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (HashMap Text Text)
data DeploymentCommandName

-- | deploy
Deploy :: DeploymentCommandName

-- | execute_recipes
ExecuteRecipes :: DeploymentCommandName

-- | install_dependencies
InstallDependencies :: DeploymentCommandName

-- | restart
Restart :: DeploymentCommandName

-- | rollback
Rollback :: DeploymentCommandName

-- | start
Start :: DeploymentCommandName

-- | stop
Stop :: DeploymentCommandName

-- | undeploy
Undeploy :: DeploymentCommandName

-- | update_custom_cookbooks
UpdateCustomCookbooks :: DeploymentCommandName

-- | update_dependencies
UpdateDependencies :: DeploymentCommandName
data Instance

-- | <a>Instance</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>iAmiId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iArchitecture</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Architecture</a></li>
--   <li><a>iAutoScalingType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>AutoScalingType</a></li>
--   <li><a>iAvailabilityZone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iBlockDeviceMappings</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>BlockDeviceMapping</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>iCreatedAt</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iEbsOptimized</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>iEc2InstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iElasticIp</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iHostname</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iInfrastructureClass</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iInstallUpdatesOnBoot</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>iInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iInstanceProfileArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iInstanceType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iLastServiceErrorId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iLayerIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>iOs</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iPrivateDns</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iPrivateIp</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iPublicDns</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iPublicIp</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iRegisteredBy</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iReportedAgentVersion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iReportedOs</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>ReportedOs</a></li>
--   <li><a>iRootDeviceType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>RootDeviceType</a></li>
--   <li><a>iRootDeviceVolumeId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iSecurityGroupIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>iSshHostDsaKeyFingerprint</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iSshHostRsaKeyFingerprint</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iSshKeyName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iStatus</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iSubnetId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iVirtualizationType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>VirtualizationType</a></li>
--   </ul>
instance' :: Instance

-- | A custom AMI ID to be used to create the instance. The AMI should be
--   based on one of the standard AWS OpsWorks APIs: Amazon Linux, Ubuntu
--   12.04 LTS, or Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. For more information, see
--   <a>Instances</a>
iAmiId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance architecture, "i386" or "x86_64".
iArchitecture :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Architecture)

-- | For load-based or time-based instances, the type.
iAutoScalingType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe AutoScalingType)

-- | The instance Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions
--   andEndpoints</a>.
iAvailabilityZone :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a> objects that specify the
--   instance's block device mappings.
iBlockDeviceMappings :: Lens' Instance [BlockDeviceMapping]

-- | The time that the instance was created.
iCreatedAt :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether this is an Amazon EBS-optimized instance.
iEbsOptimized :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ID of the associated Amazon EC2 instance.
iEc2InstanceId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance <a>Elastic IP address</a>.
iElasticIp :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance host name.
iHostname :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | For registered instances, the infrastructure class: <tt>ec2</tt> or
--   'on-premises'
iInfrastructureClass :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is
--   set to <tt>false</tt>, you must then update your instances manually by
--   using <tt>CreateDeployment</tt> to run the
--   <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack command or manually running
--   <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or 'apt-get' (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
iInstallUpdatesOnBoot :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The instance ID.
iInstanceId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the instance's IAM profile. For more information about IAM
--   ARNs, see <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
iInstanceProfileArn :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance type. AWS OpsWorks supports all instance types except
--   Cluster Compute, Cluster GPU, and High Memory Cluster. For more
--   information, see <a>Instance Families and Types</a>. The parameter
--   values that specify the various types are in the API Name column of
--   the Available Instance Types table.
iInstanceType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the last service error. For more information, call
--   <tt>DescribeServiceErrors</tt>.
iLastServiceErrorId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | An array containing the instance layer IDs.
iLayerIds :: Lens' Instance [Text]

-- | The instance's operating system.
iOs :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance private DNS name.
iPrivateDns :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance private IP address.
iPrivateIp :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance public DNS name.
iPublicDns :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance public IP address.
iPublicIp :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | For registered instances, who performed the registration.
iRegisteredBy :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's reported AWS OpsWorks agent version.
iReportedAgentVersion :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | For registered instances, the reported operating system.
iReportedOs :: Lens' Instance (Maybe ReportedOs)

-- | The instance's root device type. For more information, see <a>Storage
--   for theRoot Device</a>.
iRootDeviceType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe RootDeviceType)

-- | The root device volume ID.
iRootDeviceVolumeId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | An array containing the instance security group IDs.
iSecurityGroupIds :: Lens' Instance [Text]

-- | The SSH key's DSA fingerprint.
iSshHostDsaKeyFingerprint :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The SSH key's RSA fingerprint.
iSshHostRsaKeyFingerprint :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's Amazon EC2 key pair name.
iSshKeyName :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
iStackId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance status:
--   
--   <tt>booting</tt> <tt>connection_lost</tt> <tt>online</tt>
--   <tt>pending</tt> <tt>rebooting</tt> <tt>requested</tt>
--   <tt>running_setup</tt> <tt>setup_failed</tt> <tt>shutting_down</tt>
--   <tt>start_failed</tt> <tt>stopped</tt> <tt>stopping</tt>
--   <tt>terminated</tt> <tt>terminating</tt>
iStatus :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's subnet ID, if the stack is running in a VPC.
iSubnetId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's virtualization type, <tt>paravirtual</tt> or
--   <tt>hvm</tt>.
iVirtualizationType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe VirtualizationType)
data Deployment

-- | <a>Deployment</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dAppId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dCommand</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>DeploymentCommand</a></li>
--   <li><a>dComment</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dCompletedAt</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dCreatedAt</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dCustomJson</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dDeploymentId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dDuration</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>dIamUserArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dInstanceIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dStatus</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
deployment :: Deployment

-- | The app ID.
dAppId :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)
dCommand :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe DeploymentCommand)

-- | A user-defined comment.
dComment :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | Date when the deployment completed.
dCompletedAt :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | Date when the deployment was created.
dCreatedAt :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | A string that contains user-defined custom JSON. It can be used to
--   override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute
--   values for stack or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in
--   the following format and must escape characters such as '"'.:
--   
--   '"{"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2",...}"'
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the StackConfiguration Attributes</a>.
dCustomJson :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | The deployment ID.
dDeploymentId :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | The deployment duration.
dDuration :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Int)

-- | The user's IAM ARN.
dIamUserArn :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | The IDs of the target instances.
dInstanceIds :: Lens' Deployment [Text]

-- | The stack ID.
dStackId :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | The deployment status:
--   
--   running successful failed
dStatus :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)
data InstancesCount

-- | <a>InstancesCount</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>icAssigning</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icBooting</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icConnectionLost</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icDeregistering</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icOnline</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icPending</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icRebooting</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icRegistered</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icRegistering</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icRequested</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icRunningSetup</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icSetupFailed</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icShuttingDown</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icStartFailed</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icStopped</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icStopping</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icTerminated</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icTerminating</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>icUnassigning</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   </ul>
instancesCount :: InstancesCount

-- | The number of instances in the Assigning state.
icAssigning :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>booting</tt> status.
icBooting :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>connection_lost</tt> status.
icConnectionLost :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances in the Deregistering state.
icDeregistering :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>online</tt> status.
icOnline :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>pending</tt> status.
icPending :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>rebooting</tt> status.
icRebooting :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances in the Registered state.
icRegistered :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances in the Registering state.
icRegistering :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>requested</tt> status.
icRequested :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>running_setup</tt> status.
icRunningSetup :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>setup_failed</tt> status.
icSetupFailed :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>shutting_down</tt> status.
icShuttingDown :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>start_failed</tt> status.
icStartFailed :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>stopped</tt> status.
icStopped :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>stopping</tt> status.
icStopping :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>terminated</tt> status.
icTerminated :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>terminating</tt> status.
icTerminating :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances in the Unassigning state.
icUnassigning :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)
data AppType

-- | java
Java :: AppType

-- | nodejs
Nodejs :: AppType

-- | other
Other :: AppType

-- | php
Php :: AppType

-- | rails
Rails :: AppType

-- | static
Static :: AppType

instance AWSService OpsWorks


-- | Unassigns a registered instance from all of it's layers. The instance
--   remains in the stack as an unassigned instance and can be assigned to
--   another layer, as needed. You cannot use this action with instances
--   that were created with AWS OpsWorks.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_UnassignInstance.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.UnassignInstance
data UnassignInstance

-- | <a>UnassignInstance</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ui1InstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
unassignInstance :: Text -> UnassignInstance

-- | The instance ID.
ui1InstanceId :: Lens' UnassignInstance Text
data UnassignInstanceResponse

-- | <a>UnassignInstanceResponse</a> constructor.
unassignInstanceResponse :: UnassignInstanceResponse
instance Eq UnassignInstance
instance Ord UnassignInstance
instance Read UnassignInstance
instance Show UnassignInstance
instance Monoid UnassignInstance
instance IsString UnassignInstance
instance Eq UnassignInstanceResponse
instance Ord UnassignInstanceResponse
instance Read UnassignInstanceResponse
instance Show UnassignInstanceResponse
instance Generic UnassignInstanceResponse
instance Datatype D1UnassignInstanceResponse
instance Constructor C1_0UnassignInstanceResponse
instance AWSRequest UnassignInstance
instance ToJSON UnassignInstance
instance ToHeaders UnassignInstance
instance ToQuery UnassignInstance
instance ToPath UnassignInstance


-- | Unassigns an assigned Amazon EBS volume. The volume remains registered
--   with the stack. For more information, see <a>Resource Management</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_UnassignVolume.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.UnassignVolume
data UnassignVolume

-- | <a>UnassignVolume</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>uvVolumeId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
unassignVolume :: Text -> UnassignVolume

-- | The volume ID.
uvVolumeId :: Lens' UnassignVolume Text
data UnassignVolumeResponse

-- | <a>UnassignVolumeResponse</a> constructor.
unassignVolumeResponse :: UnassignVolumeResponse
instance Eq UnassignVolume
instance Ord UnassignVolume
instance Read UnassignVolume
instance Show UnassignVolume
instance Monoid UnassignVolume
instance IsString UnassignVolume
instance Eq UnassignVolumeResponse
instance Ord UnassignVolumeResponse
instance Read UnassignVolumeResponse
instance Show UnassignVolumeResponse
instance Generic UnassignVolumeResponse
instance Datatype D1UnassignVolumeResponse
instance Constructor C1_0UnassignVolumeResponse
instance AWSRequest UnassignVolume
instance ToJSON UnassignVolume
instance ToHeaders UnassignVolume
instance ToQuery UnassignVolume
instance ToPath UnassignVolume


-- | Updates a specified app.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Deploy or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached
--   policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on
--   user permissions, see <a>ManagingUser Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_UpdateApp.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.UpdateApp
data UpdateApp

-- | <a>UpdateApp</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>uaAppId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uaAppSource</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Source</a></li>
--   <li><a>uaAttributes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a>
--   <a>AppAttributesKeys</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uaDataSources</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>DataSource</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>uaDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uaDomains</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>uaEnableSsl</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>uaEnvironment</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>EnvironmentVariable</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>uaName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uaSslConfiguration</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>SslConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>uaType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>AppType</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateApp :: Text -> UpdateApp

-- | The app ID.
uaAppId :: Lens' UpdateApp Text

-- | A <a>Source</a> object that specifies the app repository.
uaAppSource :: Lens' UpdateApp (Maybe Source)

-- | One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack
--   attributes.
uaAttributes :: Lens' UpdateApp (HashMap AppAttributesKeys Text)

-- | The app's data sources.
uaDataSources :: Lens' UpdateApp [DataSource]

-- | A description of the app.
uaDescription :: Lens' UpdateApp (Maybe Text)

-- | The app's virtual host settings, with multiple domains separated by
--   commas. For example: ''www.example.com, example.com''
uaDomains :: Lens' UpdateApp [Text]

-- | Whether SSL is enabled for the app.
uaEnableSsl :: Lens' UpdateApp (Maybe Bool)

-- | An array of <a>EnvironmentVariable</a> objects that specify
--   environment variables to be associated with the app. After you deploy
--   the app, these variables are defined on the associated app server
--   instances.For more information, see <a>Environment Variables</a>.
--   
--   There is no specific limit on the number of environment variables.
--   However, the size of the associated data structure - which includes
--   the variables' names, values, and protected flag values - cannot
--   exceed 10 KB (10240 Bytes). This limit should accommodate most if not
--   all use cases. Exceeding it will cause an exception with the message,
--   "Environment: is too large (maximum is 10KB)."
--   
--   This parameter is supported only by Chef 11.10 stacks. If you have
--   specified one or more environment variables, you cannot modify the
--   stack's Chef version.
uaEnvironment :: Lens' UpdateApp [EnvironmentVariable]

-- | The app name.
uaName :: Lens' UpdateApp (Maybe Text)

-- | An <a>SslConfiguration</a> object with the SSL configuration.
uaSslConfiguration :: Lens' UpdateApp (Maybe SslConfiguration)

-- | The app type.
uaType :: Lens' UpdateApp (Maybe AppType)
data UpdateAppResponse

-- | <a>UpdateAppResponse</a> constructor.
updateAppResponse :: UpdateAppResponse
instance Eq UpdateApp
instance Read UpdateApp
instance Show UpdateApp
instance Eq UpdateAppResponse
instance Ord UpdateAppResponse
instance Read UpdateAppResponse
instance Show UpdateAppResponse
instance Generic UpdateAppResponse
instance Datatype D1UpdateAppResponse
instance Constructor C1_0UpdateAppResponse
instance AWSRequest UpdateApp
instance ToJSON UpdateApp
instance ToHeaders UpdateApp
instance ToQuery UpdateApp
instance ToPath UpdateApp


-- | Updates a registered Elastic IP address's name. For more information,
--   see <a>Resource Management</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_UpdateElasticIp.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.UpdateElasticIp
data UpdateElasticIp

-- | <a>UpdateElasticIp</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ueiElasticIp</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ueiName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateElasticIp :: Text -> UpdateElasticIp

-- | The address.
ueiElasticIp :: Lens' UpdateElasticIp Text

-- | The new name.
ueiName :: Lens' UpdateElasticIp (Maybe Text)
data UpdateElasticIpResponse

-- | <a>UpdateElasticIpResponse</a> constructor.
updateElasticIpResponse :: UpdateElasticIpResponse
instance Eq UpdateElasticIp
instance Ord UpdateElasticIp
instance Read UpdateElasticIp
instance Show UpdateElasticIp
instance Eq UpdateElasticIpResponse
instance Ord UpdateElasticIpResponse
instance Read UpdateElasticIpResponse
instance Show UpdateElasticIpResponse
instance Generic UpdateElasticIpResponse
instance Datatype D1UpdateElasticIpResponse
instance Constructor C1_0UpdateElasticIpResponse
instance AWSRequest UpdateElasticIp
instance ToJSON UpdateElasticIp
instance ToHeaders UpdateElasticIp
instance ToQuery UpdateElasticIp
instance ToPath UpdateElasticIp


-- | Updates a specified instance.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_UpdateInstance.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.UpdateInstance
data UpdateInstance

-- | <a>UpdateInstance</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>uiAmiId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uiArchitecture</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Architecture</a></li>
--   <li><a>uiAutoScalingType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>AutoScalingType</a></li>
--   <li><a>uiEbsOptimized</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>uiHostname</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uiInstallUpdatesOnBoot</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>uiInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uiInstanceType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uiLayerIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>uiOs</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uiSshKeyName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateInstance :: Text -> UpdateInstance

-- | A custom AMI ID to be used to create the instance. The AMI should be
--   based on one of the standard AWS OpsWorks AMIs: Amazon Linux, Ubuntu
--   12.04 LTS, or Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. For more information, see
--   <a>Instances</a>
--   
--   If you specify a custom AMI, you must set <tt>Os</tt> to
--   <a>Custom</a>.
uiAmiId :: Lens' UpdateInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance architecture. Instance types do not necessarily support
--   both architectures. For a list of the architectures that are supported
--   by the different instance types, see <a>Instance Families and
--   Types</a>.
uiArchitecture :: Lens' UpdateInstance (Maybe Architecture)

-- | For load-based or time-based instances, the type. Windows stacks can
--   use only time-based instances.
uiAutoScalingType :: Lens' UpdateInstance (Maybe AutoScalingType)

-- | Whether this is an Amazon EBS-optimized instance.
uiEbsOptimized :: Lens' UpdateInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The instance host name.
uiHostname :: Lens' UpdateInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. To control when
--   updates are installed, set this value to <tt>false</tt>. You must then
--   update your instances manually by using <tt>CreateDeployment</tt> to
--   run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack command or manually running
--   <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or 'apt-get' (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
uiInstallUpdatesOnBoot :: Lens' UpdateInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The instance ID.
uiInstanceId :: Lens' UpdateInstance Text

-- | The instance type. AWS OpsWorks supports all instance types except
--   Cluster Compute, Cluster GPU, and High Memory Cluster. For more
--   information, see <a>Instance Families and Types</a>. The parameter
--   values that you use to specify the various types are in the API Name
--   column of the Available Instance Types table.
uiInstanceType :: Lens' UpdateInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's layer IDs.
uiLayerIds :: Lens' UpdateInstance [Text]

-- | The instance's operating system, which must be set to one of the
--   following.
--   
--   For Windows stacks: Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2.
--   
--   For Linux stacks:
--   
--   Standard operating systems: an Amazon Linux version such as 'Amazon
--   Linux2014.09', 'Ubuntu 12.04 LTS', or 'Ubuntu 14.04 LTS'. Custom AMIs:
--   <a>Custom</a> The default option is the current Amazon Linux version.
--   If you set this parameter to <a>Custom</a>, you must use the
--   <tt>CreateInstance</tt> action's AmiId parameter to specify the custom
--   AMI that you want to use. For more information on the standard
--   operating systems, see <a>Operating Systems</a>For more information on
--   how to use custom AMIs with OpsWorks, see <a>Using Custom AMIs</a>.
uiOs :: Lens' UpdateInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's Amazon EC2 key name.
uiSshKeyName :: Lens' UpdateInstance (Maybe Text)
data UpdateInstanceResponse

-- | <a>UpdateInstanceResponse</a> constructor.
updateInstanceResponse :: UpdateInstanceResponse
instance Eq UpdateInstance
instance Read UpdateInstance
instance Show UpdateInstance
instance Eq UpdateInstanceResponse
instance Ord UpdateInstanceResponse
instance Read UpdateInstanceResponse
instance Show UpdateInstanceResponse
instance Generic UpdateInstanceResponse
instance Datatype D1UpdateInstanceResponse
instance Constructor C1_0UpdateInstanceResponse
instance AWSRequest UpdateInstance
instance ToJSON UpdateInstance
instance ToHeaders UpdateInstance
instance ToQuery UpdateInstance
instance ToPath UpdateInstance


-- | Updates a specified layer.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_UpdateLayer.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.UpdateLayer
data UpdateLayer

-- | <a>UpdateLayer</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ulAttributes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a>
--   <a>LayerAttributesKeys</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ulAutoAssignElasticIps</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>ulAutoAssignPublicIps</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>ulCustomInstanceProfileArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ulCustomRecipes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Recipes</a></li>
--   <li><a>ulCustomSecurityGroupIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>ulEnableAutoHealing</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>ulInstallUpdatesOnBoot</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>ulLayerId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ulLifecycleEventConfiguration</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>LifecycleEventConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>ulName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ulPackages</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>ulShortname</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ulUseEbsOptimizedInstances</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>ulVolumeConfigurations</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>VolumeConfiguration</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
updateLayer :: Text -> UpdateLayer

-- | One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack
--   attributes.
ulAttributes :: Lens' UpdateLayer (HashMap LayerAttributesKeys Text)

-- | Whether to automatically assign an <a>Elastic IP address</a> to the
--   layer's instances. For more information, see <a>How to Edit a
--   Layer</a>.
ulAutoAssignElasticIps :: Lens' UpdateLayer (Maybe Bool)

-- | For stacks that are running in a VPC, whether to automatically assign
--   a public IP address to the layer's instances. For more information,
--   see <a>How toEdit a Layer</a>.
ulAutoAssignPublicIps :: Lens' UpdateLayer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ARN of an IAM profile to be used for all of the layer's EC2
--   instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
ulCustomInstanceProfileArn :: Lens' UpdateLayer (Maybe Text)

-- | A <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt> object that specifies the layer's custom
--   recipes.
ulCustomRecipes :: Lens' UpdateLayer (Maybe Recipes)

-- | An array containing the layer's custom security group IDs.
ulCustomSecurityGroupIds :: Lens' UpdateLayer [Text]

-- | Whether to disable auto healing for the layer.
ulEnableAutoHealing :: Lens' UpdateLayer (Maybe Bool)

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. To control when
--   updates are installed, set this value to <tt>false</tt>. You must then
--   update your instances manually by using <tt>CreateDeployment</tt> to
--   run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack command or manually running
--   <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or 'apt-get' (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
ulInstallUpdatesOnBoot :: Lens' UpdateLayer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The layer ID.
ulLayerId :: Lens' UpdateLayer Text
ulLifecycleEventConfiguration :: Lens' UpdateLayer (Maybe LifecycleEventConfiguration)

-- | The layer name, which is used by the console.
ulName :: Lens' UpdateLayer (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of <tt>Package</tt> objects that describe the layer's
--   packages.
ulPackages :: Lens' UpdateLayer [Text]

-- | For custom layers only, use this parameter to specify the layer's
--   short name, which is used internally by AWS OpsWorksand by Chef. The
--   short name is also used as the name for the directory where your app
--   files are installed. It can have a maximum of 200 characters and must
--   be in the following format: <i>A[a-z0-9-_.]+Z</i>.
--   
--   The built-in layers' short names are defined by AWS OpsWorks. For more
--   information, see the <a>Layer Reference</a>
ulShortname :: Lens' UpdateLayer (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether to use Amazon EBS-optimized instances.
ulUseEbsOptimizedInstances :: Lens' UpdateLayer (Maybe Bool)

-- | A <tt>VolumeConfigurations</tt> object that describes the layer's
--   Amazon EBS volumes.
ulVolumeConfigurations :: Lens' UpdateLayer [VolumeConfiguration]
data UpdateLayerResponse

-- | <a>UpdateLayerResponse</a> constructor.
updateLayerResponse :: UpdateLayerResponse
instance Eq UpdateLayer
instance Read UpdateLayer
instance Show UpdateLayer
instance Eq UpdateLayerResponse
instance Ord UpdateLayerResponse
instance Read UpdateLayerResponse
instance Show UpdateLayerResponse
instance Generic UpdateLayerResponse
instance Datatype D1UpdateLayerResponse
instance Constructor C1_0UpdateLayerResponse
instance AWSRequest UpdateLayer
instance ToJSON UpdateLayer
instance ToHeaders UpdateLayer
instance ToQuery UpdateLayer
instance ToPath UpdateLayer
