-- | Updates a specified stack.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_UpdateStack.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.UpdateStack
data UpdateStack

-- | <a>UpdateStack</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>usAttributes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a>
--   <a>StackAttributesKeys</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>usChefConfiguration</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>ChefConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>usConfigurationManager</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>StackConfigurationManager</a></li>
--   <li><a>usCustomCookbooksSource</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Source</a></li>
--   <li><a>usCustomJson</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>usDefaultAvailabilityZone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>usDefaultInstanceProfileArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>usDefaultOs</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>usDefaultRootDeviceType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>RootDeviceType</a></li>
--   <li><a>usDefaultSshKeyName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>usDefaultSubnetId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>usHostnameTheme</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>usName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>usServiceRoleArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>usStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>usUseCustomCookbooks</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>usUseOpsworksSecurityGroups</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateStack :: Text -> UpdateStack

-- | One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack
--   attributes.
usAttributes :: Lens' UpdateStack (HashMap StackAttributesKeys Text)

-- | A <a>ChefConfiguration</a> object that specifies whether to enable
--   Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version on Chef 11.10 stacks. For more
--   information, see <a>Create aNew Stack</a>.
usChefConfiguration :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe ChefConfiguration)

-- | The configuration manager. When you clone a stack we recommend that
--   you use the configuration manager to specify the Chef version, 0.9,
--   11.4, or 11.10. The default value is currently 11.4.
usConfigurationManager :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe StackConfigurationManager)
usCustomCookbooksSource :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe Source)

-- | A string that contains user-defined, custom JSON. It can be used to
--   override the corresponding default stack configuration JSON values or
--   to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the following format
--   and must escape characters such as '"'.:
--   
--   '"{"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2",...}"'
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the StackConfiguration Attributes</a>.
usCustomJson :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's default Availability Zone, which must be in the specified
--   region. For more information, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>. If you
--   also specify a value for <tt>DefaultSubnetId</tt>, the subnet must be
--   in the same zone. For more information, see <tt>CreateStack</tt>.
usDefaultAvailabilityZone :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the
--   stack's EC2 instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
usDefaultInstanceProfileArn :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's operating system, which must be set to one of the
--   following.
--   
--   Standard Linux operating systems: an Amazon Linux version such as
--   'AmazonLinux 2014.09', 'Ubuntu 12.04 LTS', or 'Ubuntu 14.04 LTS'.
--   Custom Linux AMIs: <a>Custom</a>. You specify the custom AMI you want
--   to use when you create instances. Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2.
--   The default option is the current Amazon Linux version.
usDefaultOs :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The default root device type. This value is used by default for all
--   instances in the stack, but you can override it when you create an
--   instance. For more information, see <a>Storage for the Root
--   Device</a>.
usDefaultRootDeviceType :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe RootDeviceType)

-- | A default Amazon EC2 key pair name. The default value is none. If you
--   specify a key pair name, AWS OpsWorks installs the public key on the
--   instance and you can use the private key with an SSH client to log in
--   to the instance. For more information, see <a>Using SSH to Communicate
--   with an Instance</a> and <a>Managing SSH Access</a>. You can override
--   this setting by specifying a different key pair, or no key pair, when
--   you <a>create an instance</a>.
usDefaultSshKeyName :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's default VPC subnet ID. This parameter is required if you
--   specify a value for the <tt>VpcId</tt> parameter. All instances are
--   launched into this subnet unless you specify otherwise when you create
--   the instance. If you also specify a value for
--   <tt>DefaultAvailabilityZone</tt>, the subnet must be in that zone. For
--   information on default values and when this parameter is required, see
--   the <tt>VpcId</tt> parameter description.
usDefaultSubnetId :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's new host name theme, with spaces are replaced by
--   underscores. The theme is used to generate host names for the stack's
--   instances. By default, <tt>HostnameTheme</tt> is set to
--   <tt>Layer_Dependent</tt>, which creates host names by appending
--   integers to the layer's short name. The other themes are:
--   
--   <tt>Baked_Goods</tt> <tt>Clouds</tt> <tt>Europe_Cities</tt>
--   <tt>Fruits</tt> <tt>Greek_Deities</tt>
--   <tt>Legendary_creatures_from_Japan</tt> <tt>Planets_and_Moons</tt>
--   <tt>Roman_Deities</tt> <tt>Scottish_Islands</tt> <tt>US_Cities</tt>
--   <tt>Wild_Cats</tt> To obtain a generated host name, call
--   <tt>GetHostNameSuggestion</tt>, which returns a host name based on the
--   current theme.
usHostnameTheme :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's new name.
usName :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role, which allows
--   AWS OpsWorks to work with AWS resources on your behalf. You must set
--   this parameter to the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an existing IAM
--   role. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   You must set this parameter to a valid service role ARN or the action
--   will fail; there is no default value. You can specify the stack's
--   current service role ARN, if you prefer, but you must do so
--   explicitly.
usServiceRoleArn :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
usStackId :: Lens' UpdateStack Text

-- | Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.
usUseCustomCookbooks :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe Bool)

-- | Whether to associate the AWS OpsWorks built-in security groups with
--   the stack's layers.
--   
--   AWS OpsWorks provides a standard set of built-in security groups, one
--   for each layer, which are associated with layers by default.
--   <tt>UseOpsworksSecurityGroups</tt> allows you to instead provide your
--   own custom security groups. <tt>UseOpsworksSecurityGroups</tt> has the
--   following settings:
--   
--   True - AWS OpsWorks automatically associates the appropriate built-in
--   security group with each layer (default setting). You can associate
--   additional security groups with a layer after you create it but you
--   cannot delete the built-in security group. False - AWS OpsWorks does
--   not associate built-in security groups with layers. You must create
--   appropriate EC2 security groups and associate a security group with
--   each layer that you create. However, you can still manually associate
--   a built-in security group with a layer on creation; custom security
--   groups are required only for those layers that need custom settings.
--   For more information, see <a>Create a NewStack</a>.
usUseOpsworksSecurityGroups :: Lens' UpdateStack (Maybe Bool)
data UpdateStackResponse

-- | <a>UpdateStackResponse</a> constructor.
updateStackResponse :: UpdateStackResponse
instance Eq UpdateStack
instance Read UpdateStack
instance Show UpdateStack
instance Eq UpdateStackResponse
instance Ord UpdateStackResponse
instance Read UpdateStackResponse
instance Show UpdateStackResponse
instance Generic UpdateStackResponse
instance Datatype D1UpdateStackResponse
instance Constructor C1_0UpdateStackResponse
instance AWSRequest UpdateStack
instance ToJSON UpdateStack
instance ToHeaders UpdateStack
instance ToQuery UpdateStack
instance ToPath UpdateStack


-- | Updates a specified user profile.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have an
--   attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more
--   information on user permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_UpdateUserProfile.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.UpdateUserProfile
data UpdateUserProfile

-- | <a>UpdateUserProfile</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>uupAllowSelfManagement</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>uupIamUserArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uupSshPublicKey</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uupSshUsername</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateUserProfile :: Text -> UpdateUserProfile

-- | Whether users can specify their own SSH public key through the My
--   Settings page. For more information, see <a>Managing User
--   Permissions</a>.
uupAllowSelfManagement :: Lens' UpdateUserProfile (Maybe Bool)

-- | The user IAM ARN.
uupIamUserArn :: Lens' UpdateUserProfile Text

-- | The user's new SSH public key.
uupSshPublicKey :: Lens' UpdateUserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's SSH user name. The allowable characters are [a-z], [A-Z],
--   [0-9], <a>-</a>, and '_'. If the specified name includes other
--   punctuation marks, AWS OpsWorks removes them. For example, 'my.name'
--   will be changed to <tt>myname</tt>. If you do not specify an SSH user
--   name, AWS OpsWorks generates one from the IAM user name.
uupSshUsername :: Lens' UpdateUserProfile (Maybe Text)
data UpdateUserProfileResponse

-- | <a>UpdateUserProfileResponse</a> constructor.
updateUserProfileResponse :: UpdateUserProfileResponse
instance Eq UpdateUserProfile
instance Ord UpdateUserProfile
instance Read UpdateUserProfile
instance Show UpdateUserProfile
instance Eq UpdateUserProfileResponse
instance Ord UpdateUserProfileResponse
instance Read UpdateUserProfileResponse
instance Show UpdateUserProfileResponse
instance Generic UpdateUserProfileResponse
instance Datatype D1UpdateUserProfileResponse
instance Constructor C1_0UpdateUserProfileResponse
instance AWSRequest UpdateUserProfile
instance ToJSON UpdateUserProfile
instance ToHeaders UpdateUserProfile
instance ToQuery UpdateUserProfile
instance ToPath UpdateUserProfile

-- | Stops a specified instance. When you stop a standard instance, the
--   data disappears and must be reinstalled when you restart the instance.
--   You can stop an Amazon EBS-backed instance without losing data. For
--   more information, see <a>Starting, Stopping, and Rebooting
--   Instances</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.

-- | Specifies a user's permissions. For more information, see <a>Security
--   andPermissions</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_SetPermission.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.SetPermission
data SetPermission

-- | <a>SetPermission</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>spAllowSsh</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>spAllowSudo</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>spIamUserArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>spLevel</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>spStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
setPermission :: Text -> Text -> SetPermission

-- | The user is allowed to use SSH to communicate with the instance.
spAllowSsh :: Lens' SetPermission (Maybe Bool)

-- | The user is allowed to use sudo to elevate privileges.
spAllowSudo :: Lens' SetPermission (Maybe Bool)

-- | The user's IAM ARN.
spIamUserArn :: Lens' SetPermission Text

-- | The user's permission level, which must be set to one of the following
--   strings. You cannot set your own permissions level.
--   
--   <tt>deny</tt> <a>show</a> <tt>deploy</tt> <tt>manage</tt>
--   <tt>iam_only</tt> For more information on the permissions associated
--   with these levels, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>
spLevel :: Lens' SetPermission (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
spStackId :: Lens' SetPermission Text
data SetPermissionResponse

-- | <a>SetPermissionResponse</a> constructor.
setPermissionResponse :: SetPermissionResponse
instance Eq SetPermission
instance Ord SetPermission
instance Read SetPermission
instance Show SetPermission
instance Eq SetPermissionResponse
instance Ord SetPermissionResponse
instance Read SetPermissionResponse
instance Show SetPermissionResponse
instance Generic SetPermissionResponse
instance Datatype D1SetPermissionResponse
instance Constructor C1_0SetPermissionResponse

instance ToQuery SetPermission
instance ToPath SetPermission


-- | Specify the load-based auto scaling configuration for a specified
--   layer. For more information, see <a>Managing Load with Time-based and
--   Load-based Instances</a>.
--   
--   To use load-based auto scaling, you must create a set of load-based
--   auto scaling instances. Load-based auto scaling operates only on the
--   instances from that set, so you must ensure that you have created
--   enough instances to handle the maximum anticipated load.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_SetLoadBasedAutoScaling.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.SetLoadBasedAutoScaling
data SetLoadBasedAutoScaling

-- | <a>SetLoadBasedAutoScaling</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>slbasDownScaling</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>AutoScalingThresholds</a></li>
--   <li><a>slbasEnable</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>slbasLayerId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>slbasUpScaling</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>AutoScalingThresholds</a></li>
--   </ul>
setLoadBasedAutoScaling :: Text -> SetLoadBasedAutoScaling

-- | An <a>AutoScalingThresholds</a> object with the downscaling threshold
--   configuration. If the load falls below these thresholds for a
--   specified amount of time, AWS OpsWorks stops a specified number of
--   instances.
slbasDownScaling :: Lens' SetLoadBasedAutoScaling (Maybe AutoScalingThresholds)

-- | Enables load-based auto scaling for the layer.
slbasEnable :: Lens' SetLoadBasedAutoScaling (Maybe Bool)

-- | The layer ID.
slbasLayerId :: Lens' SetLoadBasedAutoScaling Text

-- | An <a>AutoScalingThresholds</a> object with the upscaling threshold
--   configuration. If the load exceeds these thresholds for a specified
--   amount of time, AWS OpsWorks starts a specified number of instances.
slbasUpScaling :: Lens' SetLoadBasedAutoScaling (Maybe AutoScalingThresholds)
data SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse

-- | <a>SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse</a> constructor.
setLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse :: SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse
instance Eq SetLoadBasedAutoScaling
instance Read SetLoadBasedAutoScaling
instance Show SetLoadBasedAutoScaling
instance Eq SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse
instance Ord SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse
instance Read SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse
instance Show SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse
instance Generic SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse
instance Datatype D1SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse
instance Constructor C1_0SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse
instance AWSRequest SetLoadBasedAutoScaling
instance ToJSON SetLoadBasedAutoScaling
instance ToHeaders SetLoadBasedAutoScaling
instance ToQuery SetLoadBasedAutoScaling
instance ToPath SetLoadBasedAutoScaling


-- | Registers an Amazon EBS volume with a specified stack. A volume can be
--   registered with only one stack at a time. If the volume is already
--   registered, you must first deregister it by calling
--   <tt>DeregisterVolume</tt>. For more information, see <a>Resource
--   Management</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_RegisterVolume.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.RegisterVolume

--   <li><a>rvStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
registerVolume :: Text -> RegisterVolume

-- | The Amazon EBS volume ID.
rvEc2VolumeId :: Lens' RegisterVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
rvStackId :: Lens' RegisterVolume Text

--   </ul>
registerVolumeResponse :: RegisterVolumeResponse

-- | The volume ID.
rvrVolumeId :: Lens' RegisterVolumeResponse (Maybe Text)

--   <li><a>rrdiRdsDbInstanceArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rrdiStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>

-- | Registers instances with a specified stack that were created outside
--   of AWS OpsWorks.
--   
--   We do not recommend using this action to register instances. The
--   complete registration operation has two primary steps, installing the
--   AWS OpsWorks agent on the instance and registering the instance with
--   the stack. <a>RegisterInstance</a> handles only the second step. You
--   should instead use the AWS CLI <tt>register</tt> command, which
--   performs the entire registration operation. Required Permissions: To
--   use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for
--   the stack or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions.
--   For more information on user permissions, see <a>Managing User
--   Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_RegisterInstance.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.RegisterInstance
data RegisterInstance

-- | <a>RegisterInstance</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>riHostname</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>riInstanceIdentity</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>InstanceIdentity</a></li>
--   <li><a>riPrivateIp</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>riPublicIp</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>riRsaPublicKey</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>riRsaPublicKeyFingerprint</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>riStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
registerInstance :: Text -> RegisterInstance

-- | The instance's hostname.
riHostname :: Lens' RegisterInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | An InstanceIdentity object that contains the instance's identity.
riInstanceIdentity :: Lens' RegisterInstance (Maybe InstanceIdentity)

-- | The instance's private IP address.
riPrivateIp :: Lens' RegisterInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's public IP address.
riPublicIp :: Lens' RegisterInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instances public RSA key. This key is used to encrypt
--   communication between the instance and the service.
riRsaPublicKey :: Lens' RegisterInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instances public RSA key fingerprint.
riRsaPublicKeyFingerprint :: Lens' RegisterInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the stack that the instance is to be registered with.
riStackId :: Lens' RegisterInstance Text
data RegisterInstanceResponse

-- | <a>RegisterInstanceResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rirInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
registerInstanceResponse :: RegisterInstanceResponse

-- | The registered instance's AWS OpsWorks ID.
rirInstanceId :: Lens' RegisterInstanceResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq RegisterInstance
instance Read RegisterInstance
instance Show RegisterInstance
instance Eq RegisterInstanceResponse
instance Ord RegisterInstanceResponse
instance Read RegisterInstanceResponse
instance Show RegisterInstanceResponse
instance Monoid RegisterInstanceResponse
instance FromJSON RegisterInstanceResponse
instance AWSRequest RegisterInstance
instance ToJSON RegisterInstance
instance ToHeaders RegisterInstance
instance ToQuery RegisterInstance
instance ToPath RegisterInstance


-- | Registers an Elastic IP address with a specified stack. An address can
--   be registered with only one stack at a time. If the address is already
--   registered, you must first deregister it by calling
--   <tt>DeregisterElasticIp</tt>. For more information, see <a>Resource
--   Management</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_RegisterElasticIp.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.RegisterElasticIp
data RegisterElasticIp

-- | <a>RegisterElasticIp</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>reiElasticIp</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>reiStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
registerElasticIp :: Text -> Text -> RegisterElasticIp

-- | The Elastic IP address.
reiElasticIp :: Lens' RegisterElasticIp Text

-- | The stack ID.
reiStackId :: Lens' RegisterElasticIp Text
data RegisterElasticIpResponse

-- | <a>RegisterElasticIpResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>reirElasticIp</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
registerElasticIpResponse :: RegisterElasticIpResponse

-- | The Elastic IP address.
reirElasticIp :: Lens' RegisterElasticIpResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq RegisterElasticIp
instance Ord RegisterElasticIp
instance Read RegisterElasticIp
instance Show RegisterElasticIp
instance Eq RegisterElasticIpResponse
instance Ord RegisterElasticIpResponse
instance Read RegisterElasticIpResponse
instance Show RegisterElasticIpResponse

instance FromJSON RegisterElasticIpResponse
instance AWSRequest RegisterElasticIp
instance ToJSON RegisterElasticIp
instance ToHeaders RegisterElasticIp
instance ToQuery RegisterElasticIp
instance ToPath RegisterElasticIp


-- | Reboots a specified instance. For more information, see <a>Starting,
--   Stopping,and Rebooting Instances</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_RebootInstance.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.RebootInstance
data RebootInstance

-- | <a>RebootInstance</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>riInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
rebootInstance :: Text -> RebootInstance

-- | The instance ID.
riInstanceId :: Lens' RebootInstance Text
data RebootInstanceResponse

-- | <a>RebootInstanceResponse</a> constructor.
rebootInstanceResponse :: RebootInstanceResponse

instance Ord RebootInstance
instance Read RebootInstance
instance Show RebootInstance
instance Monoid RebootInstance
instance IsString RebootInstance

instance Read RebootInstanceResponse
instance Show RebootInstanceResponse

instance ToJSON RebootInstance

instance ToQuery RebootInstance
instance ToPath RebootInstance


-- | This API can be used only with Windows stacks. Grants RDP access to a
--   Windows instance for a specified time period.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_GrantAccess.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.GrantAccess
data GrantAccess

-- | <a>GrantAccess</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>gaInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>gaValidForInMinutes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Natural</a></li>
--   </ul>
grantAccess :: Text -> GrantAccess

-- | The instance's AWS OpsWorks ID.
gaInstanceId :: Lens' GrantAccess Text

-- | The length of time (in minutes) that the grant is valid. When the
--   grant expires at the end of this period, the user will no longer be
--   able to use the credentials to log in. If the user is logged in at the
--   time, he or she automatically will be logged out.
gaValidForInMinutes :: Lens' GrantAccess (Maybe Natural)
data GrantAccessResponse

-- | <a>GrantAccessResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>garTemporaryCredential</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>TemporaryCredential</a></li>
--   </ul>
grantAccessResponse :: GrantAccessResponse

-- | A <a>TemporaryCredential</a> object that contains the data needed to
--   log in to the instance by RDP clients, such as the Microsoft Remote
--   Desktop Connection.
garTemporaryCredential :: Lens' GrantAccessResponse (Maybe TemporaryCredential)
instance Eq GrantAccess
instance Ord GrantAccess
instance Read GrantAccess
instance Show GrantAccess
instance Eq GrantAccessResponse
instance Read GrantAccessResponse
instance Show GrantAccessResponse
instance FromJSON GrantAccessResponse
instance AWSRequest GrantAccess
instance ToJSON GrantAccess
instance ToHeaders GrantAccess
instance ToQuery GrantAccess
instance ToPath GrantAccess

-- | Describes an instance's Amazon EBS volumes.
--   
--   You must specify at least one of the parameters.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Show, Deploy, or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an
--   attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more
--   information on user permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeVolumes.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.DescribeVolumes
data DescribeVolumes

-- | <a>DescribeVolumes</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dvInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dvRaidArrayId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dvStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dvVolumeIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeVolumes :: DescribeVolumes

-- | The instance ID. If you use this parameter, <a>DescribeVolumes</a>
--   returns descriptions of the volumes associated with the specified
--   instance.
dvInstanceId :: Lens' DescribeVolumes (Maybe Text)

-- | The RAID array ID. If you use this parameter, <a>DescribeVolumes</a>
--   returns descriptions of the volumes associated with the specified RAID
--   array.
dvRaidArrayId :: Lens' DescribeVolumes (Maybe Text)

-- | A stack ID. The action describes the stack's registered Amazon EBS
--   volumes.
dvStackId :: Lens' DescribeVolumes (Maybe Text)

-- | Am array of volume IDs. If you use this parameter,
--   <a>DescribeVolumes</a> returns descriptions of the specified volumes.
--   Otherwise, it returns a description of every volume.
dvVolumeIds :: Lens' DescribeVolumes [Text]
data DescribeVolumesResponse

-- | <a>DescribeVolumesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dvrVolumes</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Volume</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeVolumesResponse :: DescribeVolumesResponse

-- | An array of volume IDs.
dvrVolumes :: Lens' DescribeVolumesResponse [Volume]
instance Eq DescribeVolumes
instance Ord DescribeVolumes
instance Read DescribeVolumes
instance Show DescribeVolumes
instance Eq DescribeVolumesResponse
instance Read DescribeVolumesResponse
instance Show DescribeVolumesResponse
instance Monoid DescribeVolumesResponse
instance Semigroup DescribeVolumesResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeVolumesResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeVolumes
instance ToJSON DescribeVolumes
instance ToHeaders DescribeVolumes
instance ToQuery DescribeVolumes
instance ToPath DescribeVolumes
instance IsList DescribeVolumesResponse

-- | Describes AWS OpsWorks service errors.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Show, Deploy, or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an
--   attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more
--   information on user permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeServiceErrors.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.DescribeServiceErrors
data DescribeServiceErrors

-- | <a>DescribeServiceErrors</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dseInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dseServiceErrorIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dseStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>

--   <a>DescribeServiceErrors</a> returns descriptions of the errors
--   associated with the specified instance.
dseInstanceId :: Lens' DescribeServiceErrors (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of service error IDs. If you use this parameter,
--   <a>DescribeServiceErrors</a> returns descriptions of the specified
--   errors. Otherwise, it returns a description of every error.
dseServiceErrorIds :: Lens' DescribeServiceErrors [Text]

-- | The stack ID. If you use this parameter, <a>DescribeServiceErrors</a>
--   returns descriptions of the errors associated with the specified
--   stack.
dseStackId :: Lens' DescribeServiceErrors (Maybe Text)

-- | <a>DescribeServiceErrorsResponse</a> constructor.
--

--

--   </ul>

--   service errors.
dserServiceErrors :: Lens' DescribeServiceErrorsResponse [ServiceError']

-- | Describes Amazon RDS instances.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Show, Deploy, or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an
--   attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more
--   information on user permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeRdsDbInstances.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.DescribeRdsDbInstances
data DescribeRdsDbInstances

-- | <a>DescribeRdsDbInstances</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>drdiRdsDbInstanceArns</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>drdiStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeRdsDbInstances :: Text -> DescribeRdsDbInstances

-- | An array containing the ARNs of the instances to be described.
drdiRdsDbInstanceArns :: Lens' DescribeRdsDbInstances [Text]

-- | The stack ID that the instances are registered with. The operation
--   returns descriptions of all registered Amazon RDS instances.
drdiStackId :: Lens' DescribeRdsDbInstances Text
data DescribeRdsDbInstancesResponse

-- | <a>DescribeRdsDbInstancesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>drdirRdsDbInstances</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>RdsDbInstance</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeRdsDbInstancesResponse :: DescribeRdsDbInstancesResponse

-- | An a array of <a>RdsDbInstance</a> objects that describe the
--   instances.
drdirRdsDbInstances :: Lens' DescribeRdsDbInstancesResponse [RdsDbInstance]
instance Eq DescribeRdsDbInstances
instance Ord DescribeRdsDbInstances
instance Read DescribeRdsDbInstances
instance Show DescribeRdsDbInstances
instance Eq DescribeRdsDbInstancesResponse
instance Read DescribeRdsDbInstancesResponse
instance Show DescribeRdsDbInstancesResponse
instance Monoid DescribeRdsDbInstancesResponse
instance Semigroup DescribeRdsDbInstancesResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeRdsDbInstancesResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeRdsDbInstances
instance ToJSON DescribeRdsDbInstances
instance ToHeaders DescribeRdsDbInstances
instance ToQuery DescribeRdsDbInstances
instance ToPath DescribeRdsDbInstances
instance IsList DescribeRdsDbInstancesResponse


-- | Describe an instance's RAID arrays.
--   
--   You must specify at least one of the parameters.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Show, Deploy, or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an
--   attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more
--   information on user permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeRaidArrays.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.DescribeRaidArrays
data DescribeRaidArrays

-- | <a>DescribeRaidArrays</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>draInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>draRaidArrayIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>draStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeRaidArrays :: DescribeRaidArrays

-- | The instance ID. If you use this parameter, <a>DescribeRaidArrays</a>
--   returns descriptions of the RAID arrays associated with the specified
--   instance.
draInstanceId :: Lens' DescribeRaidArrays (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of RAID array IDs. If you use this parameter,
--   <a>DescribeRaidArrays</a> returns descriptions of the specified
--   arrays. Otherwise, it returns a description of every array.
draRaidArrayIds :: Lens' DescribeRaidArrays [Text]

-- | The stack ID.
draStackId :: Lens' DescribeRaidArrays (Maybe Text)
data DescribeRaidArraysResponse

-- | <a>DescribeRaidArraysResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>drarRaidArrays</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>RaidArray</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeRaidArraysResponse :: DescribeRaidArraysResponse

-- | A <tt>RaidArrays</tt> object that describes the specified RAID arrays.
drarRaidArrays :: Lens' DescribeRaidArraysResponse [RaidArray]
instance Eq DescribeRaidArrays
instance Ord DescribeRaidArrays
instance Read DescribeRaidArrays
instance Show DescribeRaidArrays
instance Eq DescribeRaidArraysResponse
instance Read DescribeRaidArraysResponse
instance Show DescribeRaidArraysResponse
instance Monoid DescribeRaidArraysResponse
instance Semigroup DescribeRaidArraysResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeRaidArraysResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeRaidArrays
instance ToJSON DescribeRaidArrays
instance ToHeaders DescribeRaidArrays
instance ToQuery DescribeRaidArrays
instance ToPath DescribeRaidArrays
instance IsList DescribeRaidArraysResponse


-- | Describes the permissions for a specified stack.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_DescribePermissions.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.DescribePermissions
data DescribePermissions

-- | <a>DescribePermissions</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dpIamUserArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dpStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describePermissions :: DescribePermissions

-- | The user's IAM ARN. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a> .
dpIamUserArn :: Lens' DescribePermissions (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
dpStackId :: Lens' DescribePermissions (Maybe Text)
data DescribePermissionsResponse

-- | <a>DescribePermissionsResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dprPermissions</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Permission</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describePermissionsResponse :: DescribePermissionsResponse

-- | An array of <a>Permission</a> objects that describe the stack
--   permissions.
--   
--   If the request object contains only a stack ID, the array contains a
--   <a>Permission</a> object with permissions for each of the stack IAM
--   ARNs. If the request object contains only an IAM ARN, the array
--   contains a <a>Permission</a> object with permissions for each of the
--   user's stack IDs. If the request contains a stack ID and an IAM ARN,
--   the array contains a single <a>Permission</a> object with permissions
--   for the specified stack and IAM ARN.
dprPermissions :: Lens' DescribePermissionsResponse [Permission]
instance Eq DescribePermissions
instance Ord DescribePermissions
instance Read DescribePermissions
instance Show DescribePermissions
instance Eq DescribePermissionsResponse
instance Read DescribePermissionsResponse
instance Show DescribePermissionsResponse
instance Monoid DescribePermissionsResponse
instance Semigroup DescribePermissionsResponse
instance FromJSON DescribePermissionsResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribePermissions
instance ToJSON DescribePermissions
instance ToHeaders DescribePermissions
instance ToQuery DescribePermissions
instance ToPath DescribePermissions
instance IsList DescribePermissionsResponse

--   <a>SelfUserProfile</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeMyUserProfileResponse :: DescribeMyUserProfileResponse

-- | A <a>UserProfile</a> object that describes the user's SSH information.
dmuprUserProfile :: Lens' DescribeMyUserProfileResponse (Maybe SelfUserProfile)

--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Show, Deploy, or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an
--   attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more
--   information on user permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--

--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeLayers.html</a>

-- | <a>DescribeLayers</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dlLayerIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dlStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeLayers :: DescribeLayers

-- | An array of layer IDs that specify the layers to be described. If you
--   omit this parameter, <a>DescribeLayers</a> returns a description of
--   every layer in the specified stack.
dlLayerIds :: Lens' DescribeLayers [Text]

-- | The stack ID.
dlStackId :: Lens' DescribeLayers (Maybe Text)

--   </ul>

dlrLayers :: Lens' DescribeLayersResponse [Layer]

-- | Requests a description of a set of instances.
--   
--   You must specify at least one of the parameters.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Show, Deploy, or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an
--   attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more
--   information on user permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeInstances.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.DescribeInstances
data DescribeInstances

-- | <a>DescribeInstances</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>diInstanceIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>diLayerId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>diStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeInstances :: DescribeInstances

-- | An array of instance IDs to be described. If you use this parameter,
--   <a>DescribeInstances</a> returns a description of the specified
--   instances. Otherwise, it returns a description of every instance.
diInstanceIds :: Lens' DescribeInstances [Text]

-- | A layer ID. If you use this parameter, <a>DescribeInstances</a>
--   returns descriptions of the instances associated with the specified
--   layer.
diLayerId :: Lens' DescribeInstances (Maybe Text)

-- | A stack ID. If you use this parameter, <a>DescribeInstances</a>
--   returns descriptions of the instances associated with the specified
--   stack.
diStackId :: Lens' DescribeInstances (Maybe Text)
data DescribeInstancesResponse

-- | <a>DescribeInstancesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dirInstances</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Instance</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeInstancesResponse :: DescribeInstancesResponse

-- | An array of <a>Instance</a> objects that describe the instances.
dirInstances :: Lens' DescribeInstancesResponse [Instance]

--   You must specify at least one of the parameters.
--

--   attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more
--   information on user permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeElasticIps.html</a>

-- | <a>DescribeElasticIps</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--

--   <li><a>deiInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>deiIps</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>

--   </ul>
describeElasticIps :: DescribeElasticIps

--   <a>DescribeElasticIps</a> returns a description of the Elastic IP
--   addresses associated with the specified instance.
deiInstanceId :: Lens' DescribeElasticIps (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of Elastic IP addresses to be described. If you include this
--   parameter, <a>DescribeElasticIps</a> returns a description of the
--   specified Elastic IP addresses. Otherwise, it returns a description of
--   every Elastic IP address.
deiIps :: Lens' DescribeElasticIps [Text]

-- | A stack ID. If you include this parameter, <a>DescribeElasticIps</a>
--   returns a description of the Elastic IP addresses that are registered
--   with the specified stack.
deiStackId :: Lens' DescribeElasticIps (Maybe Text)

-- | <a>DescribeElasticIpsResponse</a> constructor.

--   </ul>

--   addresses.
deirElasticIps :: Lens' DescribeElasticIpsResponse [ElasticIp]

--   returns a description of the commands associated with the specified

--   specified deployments. Otherwise, it returns a description of every
--   deployment.

-- | Describes the results of specified commands.
--   
--   You must specify at least one of the parameters.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Show, Deploy, or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an
--   attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more
--   information on user permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeCommands.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.DescribeCommands
data DescribeCommands

-- | <a>DescribeCommands</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dcCommandIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dcDeploymentId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dcInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeCommands :: DescribeCommands

-- | An array of command IDs. If you include this parameter,
--   <a>DescribeCommands</a> returns a description of the specified
--   commands. Otherwise, it returns a description of every command.
dcCommandIds :: Lens' DescribeCommands [Text]

-- | The deployment ID. If you include this parameter,
--   <a>DescribeCommands</a> returns a description of the commands
--   associated with the specified deployment.
dcDeploymentId :: Lens' DescribeCommands (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance ID. If you include this parameter,
--   <a>DescribeCommands</a> returns a description of the commands
--   associated with the specified instance.
dcInstanceId :: Lens' DescribeCommands (Maybe Text)
data DescribeCommandsResponse

-- | <a>DescribeCommandsResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dcrCommands</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Command</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeCommandsResponse :: DescribeCommandsResponse

-- | An array of <a>Command</a> objects that describe each of the specified
--   commands.
dcrCommands :: Lens' DescribeCommandsResponse [Command]
instance Eq DescribeCommands
instance Ord DescribeCommands
instance Read DescribeCommands
instance Show DescribeCommands
instance Eq DescribeCommandsResponse
instance Read DescribeCommandsResponse
instance Show DescribeCommandsResponse
instance Monoid DescribeCommandsResponse
instance Semigroup DescribeCommandsResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeCommandsResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeCommands
instance ToJSON DescribeCommands
instance ToHeaders DescribeCommands
instance ToQuery DescribeCommands
instance ToPath DescribeCommands
instance IsList DescribeCommandsResponse


-- | Requests a description of a specified set of apps.
--   
--   You must specify at least one of the parameters.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Show, Deploy, or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an
--   attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more
--   information on user permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeApps.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.DescribeApps
data DescribeApps

-- | <a>DescribeApps</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>daAppIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>daStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeApps :: DescribeApps

-- | An array of app IDs for the apps to be described. If you use this
--   parameter, <a>DescribeApps</a> returns a description of the specified
--   apps. Otherwise, it returns a description of every app.
daAppIds :: Lens' DescribeApps [Text]

-- | The app stack ID. If you use this parameter, <a>DescribeApps</a>
--   returns a description of the apps in the specified stack.
daStackId :: Lens' DescribeApps (Maybe Text)
data DescribeAppsResponse

-- | <a>DescribeAppsResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>darApps</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>App</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeAppsResponse :: DescribeAppsResponse

-- | An array of <a>App</a> objects that describe the specified apps.
darApps :: Lens' DescribeAppsResponse [App]
instance Eq DescribeApps
instance Ord DescribeApps
instance Read DescribeApps
instance Show DescribeApps
instance Eq DescribeAppsResponse
instance Read DescribeAppsResponse
instance Show DescribeAppsResponse
instance Monoid DescribeAppsResponse
instance Semigroup DescribeAppsResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeAppsResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeApps
instance ToJSON DescribeApps
instance ToHeaders DescribeApps
instance ToQuery DescribeApps
instance ToPath DescribeApps
instance IsList DescribeAppsResponse


-- | Deregisters an Amazon EBS volume. The volume can then be registered by
--   another stack. For more information, see <a>Resource Management</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_DeregisterVolume.html</a>

-- | <a>DeregisterVolume</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dvVolumeId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
deregisterVolume :: Text -> DeregisterVolume

-- | The AWS OpsWorks volume ID, which is the GUID that AWS OpsWorks
--   assigned to the instance when you registered the volume with the
--   stack, not the Amazon EC2 volume ID.
dvVolumeId :: Lens' DeregisterVolume Text
data DeregisterVolumeResponse

--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
