-- | Creates a new user profile.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have an
--   attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more
--   information on user permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_CreateUserProfile.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.CreateUserProfile
data CreateUserProfile

-- | <a>CreateUserProfile</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cupAllowSelfManagement</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>cupIamUserArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cupSshPublicKey</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cupSshUsername</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createUserProfile :: Text -> CreateUserProfile

-- | Whether users can specify their own SSH public key through the My
--   Settings page. For more information, see <a>Setting an IAM User's
--   Public SSH Key</a>.
cupAllowSelfManagement :: Lens' CreateUserProfile (Maybe Bool)

-- | The user's IAM ARN.
cupIamUserArn :: Lens' CreateUserProfile Text

-- | The user's public SSH key.
cupSshPublicKey :: Lens' CreateUserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's SSH user name. The allowable characters are [a-z], [A-Z],
--   [0-9], <a>-</a>, and '_'. If the specified name includes other
--   punctuation marks, AWS OpsWorks removes them. For example, 'my.name'
--   will be changed to <tt>myname</tt>. If you do not specify an SSH user
--   name, AWS OpsWorks generates one from the IAM user name.
cupSshUsername :: Lens' CreateUserProfile (Maybe Text)
data CreateUserProfileResponse

-- | <a>CreateUserProfileResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cuprIamUserArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createUserProfileResponse :: CreateUserProfileResponse

-- | The user's IAM ARN.
cuprIamUserArn :: Lens' CreateUserProfileResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateUserProfile
instance Ord CreateUserProfile
instance Read CreateUserProfile
instance Show CreateUserProfile
instance Eq CreateUserProfileResponse
instance Ord CreateUserProfileResponse
instance Read CreateUserProfileResponse
instance Show CreateUserProfileResponse
instance Monoid CreateUserProfileResponse
instance FromJSON CreateUserProfileResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateUserProfile
instance ToJSON CreateUserProfile
instance ToHeaders CreateUserProfile
instance ToQuery CreateUserProfile
instance ToPath CreateUserProfile


-- | Creates a new stack. For more information, see <a>Create a New
--   Stack</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have an
--   attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more
--   information on user permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_CreateStack.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.CreateStack
data CreateStack

-- | <a>CreateStack</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>csAttributes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a>
--   <a>StackAttributesKeys</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csChefConfiguration</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>ChefConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>csConfigurationManager</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>StackConfigurationManager</a></li>
--   <li><a>csCustomCookbooksSource</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Source</a></li>
--   <li><a>csCustomJson</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csDefaultAvailabilityZone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csDefaultInstanceProfileArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csDefaultOs</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csDefaultRootDeviceType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>RootDeviceType</a></li>
--   <li><a>csDefaultSshKeyName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csDefaultSubnetId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csHostnameTheme</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csRegion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csServiceRoleArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csUseCustomCookbooks</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>csUseOpsworksSecurityGroups</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>csVpcId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createStack :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateStack

-- | One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack
--   attributes.
csAttributes :: Lens' CreateStack (HashMap StackAttributesKeys Text)

-- | A <a>ChefConfiguration</a> object that specifies whether to enable
--   Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version on Chef 11.10 stacks. For more
--   information, see <a>Create aNew Stack</a>.
csChefConfiguration :: Lens' CreateStack (Maybe ChefConfiguration)

-- | The configuration manager. When you clone a stack we recommend that
--   you use the configuration manager to specify the Chef version, 0.9,
--   11.4, or 11.10. The default value is currently 11.4.
csConfigurationManager :: Lens' CreateStack (Maybe StackConfigurationManager)
csCustomCookbooksSource :: Lens' CreateStack (Maybe Source)

-- | A string that contains user-defined, custom JSON. It can be used to
--   override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute
--   values, or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the
--   following format and must escape characters such as '"'.:
--   
--   '"{"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2",...}"'
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the StackConfiguration Attributes</a>.
csCustomJson :: Lens' CreateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's default Availability Zone, which must be in the specified
--   region. For more information, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>. If you
--   also specify a value for <tt>DefaultSubnetId</tt>, the subnet must be
--   in the same zone. For more information, see the <tt>VpcId</tt>
--   parameter description.
csDefaultAvailabilityZone :: Lens' CreateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the
--   stack's EC2 instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
csDefaultInstanceProfileArn :: Lens' CreateStack Text

-- | The stack's operating system, which must be set to one of the
--   following.
--   
--   Standard Linux operating systems: an Amazon Linux version such as
--   'AmazonLinux 2014.09', 'Ubuntu 12.04 LTS', or 'Ubuntu 14.04 LTS'.
--   Custom Linux AMIs: <a>Custom</a>. You specify the custom AMI you want
--   to use when you create instances. Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2.
--   The default option is the current Amazon Linux version.
csDefaultOs :: Lens' CreateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The default root device type. This value is used by default for all
--   instances in the stack, but you can override it when you create an
--   instance. The default option is 'instance-store'. For more
--   information, see <a>Storage for theRoot Device</a>.
csDefaultRootDeviceType :: Lens' CreateStack (Maybe RootDeviceType)

-- | A default Amazon EC2 key pair name. The default value is none. If you
--   specify a key pair name, AWS OpsWorks installs the public key on the
--   instance and you can use the private key with an SSH client to log in
--   to the instance. For more information, see <a>Using SSH to Communicate
--   with an Instance</a> and <a>Managing SSH Access</a>. You can override
--   this setting by specifying a different key pair, or no key pair, when
--   you <a>create an instance</a>.
csDefaultSshKeyName :: Lens' CreateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's default VPC subnet ID. This parameter is required if you
--   specify a value for the <tt>VpcId</tt> parameter. All instances are
--   launched into this subnet unless you specify otherwise when you create
--   the instance. If you also specify a value for
--   <tt>DefaultAvailabilityZone</tt>, the subnet must be in that zone. For
--   information on default values and when this parameter is required, see
--   the <tt>VpcId</tt> parameter description.
csDefaultSubnetId :: Lens' CreateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's host name theme, with spaces are replaced by underscores.
--   The theme is used to generate host names for the stack's instances. By
--   default, <tt>HostnameTheme</tt> is set to <tt>Layer_Dependent</tt>,
--   which creates host names by appending integers to the layer's short
--   name. The other themes are:
--   
--   <tt>Baked_Goods</tt> <tt>Clouds</tt> <tt>Europe_Cities</tt>
--   <tt>Fruits</tt> <tt>Greek_Deities</tt>
--   <tt>Legendary_creatures_from_Japan</tt> <tt>Planets_and_Moons</tt>
--   <tt>Roman_Deities</tt> <tt>Scottish_Islands</tt> <tt>US_Cities</tt>
--   <tt>Wild_Cats</tt> To obtain a generated host name, call
--   <tt>GetHostNameSuggestion</tt>, which returns a host name based on the
--   current theme.
csHostnameTheme :: Lens' CreateStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack name.
csName :: Lens' CreateStack Text

-- | The stack AWS region, such as "us-east-1". For more information about
--   Amazon regions, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
csRegion :: Lens' CreateStack Text

-- | The stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role, which allows
--   AWS OpsWorks to work with AWS resources on your behalf. You must set
--   this parameter to the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an existing IAM
--   role. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
csServiceRoleArn :: Lens' CreateStack Text

-- | Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.
csUseCustomCookbooks :: Lens' CreateStack (Maybe Bool)

-- | Whether to associate the AWS OpsWorks built-in security groups with
--   the stack's layers.
--   
--   AWS OpsWorks provides a standard set of built-in security groups, one
--   for each layer, which are associated with layers by default. With
--   <tt>UseOpsworksSecurityGroups</tt> you can instead provide your own
--   custom security groups. <tt>UseOpsworksSecurityGroups</tt> has the
--   following settings:
--   
--   True - AWS OpsWorks automatically associates the appropriate built-in
--   security group with each layer (default setting). You can associate
--   additional security groups with a layer after you create it but you
--   cannot delete the built-in security group. False - AWS OpsWorks does
--   not associate built-in security groups with layers. You must create
--   appropriate EC2 security groups and associate a security group with
--   each layer that you create. However, you can still manually associate
--   a built-in security group with a layer on creation; custom security
--   groups are required only for those layers that need custom settings.
--   For more information, see <a>Create a NewStack</a>.
csUseOpsworksSecurityGroups :: Lens' CreateStack (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ID of the VPC that the stack is to be launched into. It must be in
--   the specified region. All instances are launched into this VPC, and
--   you cannot change the ID later.
--   
--   If your account supports EC2 Classic, the default value is no VPC. If
--   your account does not support EC2 Classic, the default value is the
--   default VPC for the specified region. If the VPC ID corresponds to a
--   default VPC and you have specified either the
--   <tt>DefaultAvailabilityZone</tt> or the <tt>DefaultSubnetId</tt>
--   parameter only, AWS OpsWorks infers the value of the other parameter.
--   If you specify neither parameter, AWS OpsWorks sets these parameters
--   to the first valid Availability Zone for the specified region and the
--   corresponding default VPC subnet ID, respectively.
--   
--   If you specify a nondefault VPC ID, note the following:
--   
--   It must belong to a VPC in your account that is in the specified
--   region. You must specify a value for <tt>DefaultSubnetId</tt>. For
--   more information on how to use AWS OpsWorks with a VPC, see <a>Running
--   a Stack in a VPC</a>. For more information on default VPC and EC2
--   Classic, see <a>Supported Platforms</a>.
csVpcId :: Lens' CreateStack (Maybe Text)
data CreateStackResponse

-- | <a>CreateStackResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>csr1StackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createStackResponse :: CreateStackResponse

-- | The stack ID, which is an opaque string that you use to identify the
--   stack when performing actions such as <tt>DescribeStacks</tt>.
csr1StackId :: Lens' CreateStackResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateStack
instance Read CreateStack
instance Show CreateStack
instance Eq CreateStackResponse
instance Ord CreateStackResponse
instance Read CreateStackResponse
instance Show CreateStackResponse
instance Monoid CreateStackResponse
instance FromJSON CreateStackResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateStack
instance ToJSON CreateStack
instance ToHeaders CreateStack
instance ToQuery CreateStack
instance ToPath CreateStack


-- | Creates a layer. For more information, see <a>How to Create a
--   Layer</a>.
--   
--   You should use CreateLayer for noncustom layer types such as PHP App
--   Server only if the stack does not have an existing layer of that type.
--   A stack can have at most one instance of each noncustom layer; if you
--   attempt to create a second instance, CreateLayer fails. A stack can
--   have an arbitrary number of custom layers, so you can call CreateLayer
--   as many times as you like for that layer type.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_CreateLayer.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.CreateLayer
data CreateLayer

-- | <a>CreateLayer</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>clAttributes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a>
--   <a>LayerAttributesKeys</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clAutoAssignElasticIps</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>clAutoAssignPublicIps</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>clCustomInstanceProfileArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clCustomRecipes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Recipes</a></li>
--   <li><a>clCustomSecurityGroupIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>clEnableAutoHealing</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>clInstallUpdatesOnBoot</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>clLifecycleEventConfiguration</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>LifecycleEventConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>clName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clPackages</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>clShortname</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>LayerType</a></li>
--   <li><a>clUseEbsOptimizedInstances</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>clVolumeConfigurations</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>VolumeConfiguration</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
createLayer :: Text -> LayerType -> Text -> Text -> CreateLayer

-- | One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack
--   attributes.
clAttributes :: Lens' CreateLayer (HashMap LayerAttributesKeys Text)

-- | Whether to automatically assign an <a>Elastic IP address</a> to the
--   layer's instances. For more information, see <a>How to Edit a
--   Layer</a>.
clAutoAssignElasticIps :: Lens' CreateLayer (Maybe Bool)

-- | For stacks that are running in a VPC, whether to automatically assign
--   a public IP address to the layer's instances. For more information,
--   see <a>How toEdit a Layer</a>.
clAutoAssignPublicIps :: Lens' CreateLayer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ARN of an IAM profile that to be used for the layer's EC2
--   instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
clCustomInstanceProfileArn :: Lens' CreateLayer (Maybe Text)

-- | A <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt> object that specifies the layer custom
--   recipes.
clCustomRecipes :: Lens' CreateLayer (Maybe Recipes)

-- | An array containing the layer custom security group IDs.
clCustomSecurityGroupIds :: Lens' CreateLayer [Text]

-- | Whether to disable auto healing for the layer.
clEnableAutoHealing :: Lens' CreateLayer (Maybe Bool)

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. To control when
--   updates are installed, set this value to <tt>false</tt>. You must then
--   update your instances manually by using <tt>CreateDeployment</tt> to
--   run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack command or manually running
--   <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or 'apt-get' (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
clInstallUpdatesOnBoot :: Lens' CreateLayer (Maybe Bool)

-- | A LifeCycleEventConfiguration object that you can use to configure the
--   Shutdown event to specify an execution timeout and enable or disable
--   Elastic Load Balancer connection draining.
clLifecycleEventConfiguration :: Lens' CreateLayer (Maybe LifecycleEventConfiguration)

-- | The layer name, which is used by the console.
clName :: Lens' CreateLayer Text

-- | An array of <tt>Package</tt> objects that describe the layer packages.
clPackages :: Lens' CreateLayer [Text]

-- | For custom layers only, use this parameter to specify the layer's
--   short name, which is used internally by AWS OpsWorks and by Chef
--   recipes. The short name is also used as the name for the directory
--   where your app files are installed. It can have a maximum of 200
--   characters, which are limited to the alphanumeric characters,
--   <a>-</a>, '_', and <a>.</a>.
--   
--   The built-in layers' short names are defined by AWS OpsWorks. For more
--   information, see the <a>Layer Reference</a>
clShortname :: Lens' CreateLayer Text

-- | The layer stack ID.
clStackId :: Lens' CreateLayer Text

-- | The layer type. A stack cannot have more than one built-in layer of
--   the same type. It can have any number of custom layers.
clType :: Lens' CreateLayer LayerType

-- | Whether to use Amazon EBS-optimized instances.
clUseEbsOptimizedInstances :: Lens' CreateLayer (Maybe Bool)

-- | A <tt>VolumeConfigurations</tt> object that describes the layer's
--   Amazon EBS volumes.
clVolumeConfigurations :: Lens' CreateLayer [VolumeConfiguration]
data CreateLayerResponse

-- | <a>CreateLayerResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>clrLayerId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createLayerResponse :: CreateLayerResponse

-- | The layer ID.
clrLayerId :: Lens' CreateLayerResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateLayer
instance Read CreateLayer
instance Show CreateLayer
instance Eq CreateLayerResponse
instance Ord CreateLayerResponse
instance Read CreateLayerResponse
instance Show CreateLayerResponse
instance Monoid CreateLayerResponse
instance FromJSON CreateLayerResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateLayer
instance ToJSON CreateLayer
instance ToHeaders CreateLayer
instance ToQuery CreateLayer
instance ToPath CreateLayer


-- | Creates an instance in a specified stack. For more information, see
--   <a>Adding anInstance to a Layer</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_CreateInstance.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.CreateInstance
data CreateInstance

-- | <a>CreateInstance</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ciAmiId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciArchitecture</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Architecture</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciAutoScalingType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>AutoScalingType</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciAvailabilityZone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciBlockDeviceMappings</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>BlockDeviceMapping</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>ciEbsOptimized</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciHostname</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciInstallUpdatesOnBoot</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciInstanceType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciLayerIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>ciOs</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciRootDeviceType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>RootDeviceType</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciSshKeyName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciSubnetId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciVirtualizationType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createInstance :: Text -> Text -> CreateInstance

-- | A custom AMI ID to be used to create the instance. The AMI should be
--   based on one of the standard AWS OpsWorks AMIs: Amazon Linux, Ubuntu
--   12.04 LTS, or Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. For more information, see
--   <a>Instances</a>.
--   
--   If you specify a custom AMI, you must set <tt>Os</tt> to
--   <a>Custom</a>.
ciAmiId :: Lens' CreateInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance architecture. The default option is <tt>x86_64</tt>.
--   Instance types do not necessarily support both architectures. For a
--   list of the architectures that are supported by the different instance
--   types, see <a>Instance Families andTypes</a>.
ciArchitecture :: Lens' CreateInstance (Maybe Architecture)

-- | For load-based or time-based instances, the type. Windows stacks can
--   use only time-based instances.
ciAutoScalingType :: Lens' CreateInstance (Maybe AutoScalingType)

-- | The instance Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions
--   andEndpoints</a>.
ciAvailabilityZone :: Lens' CreateInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a> objects that specify the
--   instance's block devices. For more information, see <a>Block Device
--   Mapping</a>.
ciBlockDeviceMappings :: Lens' CreateInstance [BlockDeviceMapping]

-- | Whether to create an Amazon EBS-optimized instance.
ciEbsOptimized :: Lens' CreateInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The instance host name.
ciHostname :: Lens' CreateInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. To control when
--   updates are installed, set this value to <tt>false</tt>. You must then
--   update your instances manually by using <tt>CreateDeployment</tt> to
--   run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack command or manually running
--   <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or 'apt-get' (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt> to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
ciInstallUpdatesOnBoot :: Lens' CreateInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The instance type. AWS OpsWorks supports all instance types except
--   Cluster Compute, Cluster GPU, and High Memory Cluster. For more
--   information, see <a>Instance Families and Types</a>. The parameter
--   values that you use to specify the various types are in the API Name
--   column of the Available Instance Types table.
ciInstanceType :: Lens' CreateInstance Text

-- | An array that contains the instance layer IDs.
ciLayerIds :: Lens' CreateInstance [Text]

-- | The instance's operating system, which must be set to one of the
--   following.
--   
--   For Windows stacks: Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2.
--   
--   For Linux stacks:
--   
--   Standard operating systems: an Amazon Linux version such as 'Amazon
--   Linux2014.09', 'Ubuntu 12.04 LTS', or 'Ubuntu 14.04 LTS'. Custom AMIs:
--   <a>Custom</a> The default option is the current Amazon Linux version.
--   If you set this parameter to <a>Custom</a>, you must use the
--   <a>CreateInstance</a> action's AmiId parameter to specify the custom
--   AMI that you want to use. For more information on the standard
--   operating systems, see <a>Operating Systems</a>For more information on
--   how to use custom AMIs with OpsWorks, see <a>Using Custom AMIs</a>.
ciOs :: Lens' CreateInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance root device type. For more information, see <a>Storage
--   for the RootDevice</a>.
ciRootDeviceType :: Lens' CreateInstance (Maybe RootDeviceType)

-- | The instance's Amazon EC2 key pair name.
ciSshKeyName :: Lens' CreateInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
ciStackId :: Lens' CreateInstance Text

-- | The ID of the instance's subnet. If the stack is running in a VPC, you
--   can use this parameter to override the stack's default subnet ID value
--   and direct AWS OpsWorks to launch the instance in a different subnet.
ciSubnetId :: Lens' CreateInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's virtualization type, <tt>paravirtual</tt> or
--   <tt>hvm</tt>.
ciVirtualizationType :: Lens' CreateInstance (Maybe Text)
data CreateInstanceResponse

-- | <a>CreateInstanceResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cirInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createInstanceResponse :: CreateInstanceResponse

-- | The instance ID.
cirInstanceId :: Lens' CreateInstanceResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateInstance
instance Read CreateInstance
instance Show CreateInstance
instance Eq CreateInstanceResponse
instance Ord CreateInstanceResponse
instance Read CreateInstanceResponse
instance Show CreateInstanceResponse
instance Monoid CreateInstanceResponse
instance FromJSON CreateInstanceResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateInstance
instance ToJSON CreateInstance
instance ToHeaders CreateInstance
instance ToQuery CreateInstance
instance ToPath CreateInstance


-- | Runs deployment or stack commands. For more information, see
--   <a>Deploying Apps</a> and <a>Run Stack Commands</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Deploy or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached
--   policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on
--   user permissions, see <a>ManagingUser Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_CreateDeployment.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.CreateDeployment
data CreateDeployment

-- | <a>CreateDeployment</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cdAppId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdCommand</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>DeploymentCommand</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdComment</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdCustomJson</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdInstanceIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>cdStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createDeployment :: Text -> DeploymentCommand -> CreateDeployment

-- | The app ID. This parameter is required for app deployments, but not
--   for other deployment commands.
cdAppId :: Lens' CreateDeployment (Maybe Text)

-- | A <a>DeploymentCommand</a> object that specifies the deployment
--   command and any associated arguments.
cdCommand :: Lens' CreateDeployment DeploymentCommand

-- | A user-defined comment.
cdComment :: Lens' CreateDeployment (Maybe Text)

-- | A string that contains user-defined, custom JSON. It is used to
--   override the corresponding default stack configuration JSON values.
--   The string should be in the following format and must escape
--   characters such as '"'.:
--   
--   '"{"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2",...}"'
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the StackConfiguration Attributes</a>.
cdCustomJson :: Lens' CreateDeployment (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance IDs for the deployment targets.
cdInstanceIds :: Lens' CreateDeployment [Text]

-- | The stack ID.
cdStackId :: Lens' CreateDeployment Text
data CreateDeploymentResponse

-- | <a>CreateDeploymentResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cdrDeploymentId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createDeploymentResponse :: CreateDeploymentResponse

-- | The deployment ID, which can be used with other requests to identify
--   the deployment.
cdrDeploymentId :: Lens' CreateDeploymentResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateDeployment
instance Read CreateDeployment
instance Show CreateDeployment
instance Eq CreateDeploymentResponse
instance Ord CreateDeploymentResponse
instance Read CreateDeploymentResponse
instance Show CreateDeploymentResponse
instance Monoid CreateDeploymentResponse
instance FromJSON CreateDeploymentResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateDeployment
instance ToJSON CreateDeployment
instance ToHeaders CreateDeployment
instance ToQuery CreateDeployment
instance ToPath CreateDeployment


-- | Creates an app for a specified stack. For more information, see
--   <a>Creating Apps</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_CreateApp.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.CreateApp
data CreateApp

-- | <a>CreateApp</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>caAppSource</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Source</a></li>
--   <li><a>caAttributes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a>
--   <a>AppAttributesKeys</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>caDataSources</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>DataSource</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>caDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>caDomains</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>caEnableSsl</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>caEnvironment</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>EnvironmentVariable</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>caName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>caShortname</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>caSslConfiguration</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>SslConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>caStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>caType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>AppType</a></li>
--   </ul>
createApp :: Text -> Text -> AppType -> CreateApp

-- | A <a>Source</a> object that specifies the app repository.
caAppSource :: Lens' CreateApp (Maybe Source)

-- | One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack
--   attributes.
caAttributes :: Lens' CreateApp (HashMap AppAttributesKeys Text)

-- | The app's data source.
caDataSources :: Lens' CreateApp [DataSource]

-- | A description of the app.
caDescription :: Lens' CreateApp (Maybe Text)

-- | The app virtual host settings, with multiple domains separated by
--   commas. For example: ''www.example.com, example.com''
caDomains :: Lens' CreateApp [Text]

-- | Whether to enable SSL for the app.
caEnableSsl :: Lens' CreateApp (Maybe Bool)

-- | An array of <a>EnvironmentVariable</a> objects that specify
--   environment variables to be associated with the app. After you deploy
--   the app, these variables are defined on the associated app server
--   instance. For more information, see <a>Environment Variables</a>.
--   
--   There is no specific limit on the number of environment variables.
--   However, the size of the associated data structure - which includes
--   the variables' names, values, and protected flag values - cannot
--   exceed 10 KB (10240 Bytes). This limit should accommodate most if not
--   all use cases. Exceeding it will cause an exception with the message,
--   "Environment: is too large (maximum is 10KB)."
--   
--   This parameter is supported only by Chef 11.10 stacks. If you have
--   specified one or more environment variables, you cannot modify the
--   stack's Chef version.
caEnvironment :: Lens' CreateApp [EnvironmentVariable]

-- | The app name.
caName :: Lens' CreateApp Text

-- | The app's short name.
caShortname :: Lens' CreateApp (Maybe Text)

-- | An <a>SslConfiguration</a> object with the SSL configuration.
caSslConfiguration :: Lens' CreateApp (Maybe SslConfiguration)

-- | The stack ID.
caStackId :: Lens' CreateApp Text

-- | The app type. Each supported type is associated with a particular
--   layer. For example, PHP applications are associated with a PHP layer.
--   AWS OpsWorks deploys an application to those instances that are
--   members of the corresponding layer. If your app isn't one of the
--   standard types, or you prefer to implement your own Deploy recipes,
--   specify <tt>other</tt>.
caType :: Lens' CreateApp AppType
data CreateAppResponse

-- | <a>CreateAppResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>carAppId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createAppResponse :: CreateAppResponse

-- | The app ID.
carAppId :: Lens' CreateAppResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateApp
instance Read CreateApp
instance Show CreateApp
instance Eq CreateAppResponse
instance Ord CreateAppResponse
instance Read CreateAppResponse
instance Show CreateAppResponse
instance Monoid CreateAppResponse
instance FromJSON CreateAppResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateApp
instance ToJSON CreateApp
instance ToHeaders CreateApp
instance ToQuery CreateApp
instance ToPath CreateApp


-- | Creates a clone of a specified stack. For more information, see
--   <a>Clone a Stack</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have an
--   attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more
--   information on user permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_CloneStack.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.CloneStack
data CloneStack

-- | <a>CloneStack</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cs1Attributes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a>
--   <a>StackAttributesKeys</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1ChefConfiguration</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>ChefConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1CloneAppIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>cs1ClonePermissions</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1ConfigurationManager</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>StackConfigurationManager</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1CustomCookbooksSource</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Source</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1CustomJson</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1DefaultAvailabilityZone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1DefaultInstanceProfileArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1DefaultOs</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1DefaultRootDeviceType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>RootDeviceType</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1DefaultSshKeyName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1DefaultSubnetId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1HostnameTheme</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1Name</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1Region</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1ServiceRoleArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1SourceStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1UseCustomCookbooks</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1UseOpsworksSecurityGroups</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>cs1VpcId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
cloneStack :: Text -> Text -> CloneStack

-- | A list of stack attributes and values as key/value pairs to be added
--   to the cloned stack.
cs1Attributes :: Lens' CloneStack (HashMap StackAttributesKeys Text)

-- | A <a>ChefConfiguration</a> object that specifies whether to enable
--   Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version on Chef 11.10 stacks. For more
--   information, see <a>Create aNew Stack</a>.
cs1ChefConfiguration :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe ChefConfiguration)

-- | A list of source stack app IDs to be included in the cloned stack.
cs1CloneAppIds :: Lens' CloneStack [Text]

-- | Whether to clone the source stack's permissions.
cs1ClonePermissions :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe Bool)

-- | The configuration manager. When you clone a stack we recommend that
--   you use the configuration manager to specify the Chef version, 0.9,
--   11.4, or 11.10. The default value is currently 11.4.
cs1ConfigurationManager :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe StackConfigurationManager)
cs1CustomCookbooksSource :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe Source)

-- | A string that contains user-defined, custom JSON. It is used to
--   override the corresponding default stack configuration JSON values.
--   The string should be in the following format and must escape
--   characters such as '"'.:
--   
--   '"{"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2",...}"'
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the StackConfiguration Attributes</a>
cs1CustomJson :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The cloned stack's default Availability Zone, which must be in the
--   specified region. For more information, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a>. If you also specify a value for
--   <tt>DefaultSubnetId</tt>, the subnet must be in the same zone. For
--   more information, see the <tt>VpcId</tt> parameter description.
cs1DefaultAvailabilityZone :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the
--   stack's EC2 instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
cs1DefaultInstanceProfileArn :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's operating system, which must be set to one of the
--   following.
--   
--   Standard Linux operating systems: an Amazon Linux version such as
--   'AmazonLinux 2014.09', 'Ubuntu 12.04 LTS', or 'Ubuntu 14.04 LTS'.
--   Custom Linux AMIs: <a>Custom</a>. You specify the custom AMI you want
--   to use when you create instances. Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2.
--   The default option is the current Amazon Linux version.
cs1DefaultOs :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The default root device type. This value is used by default for all
--   instances in the cloned stack, but you can override it when you create
--   an instance. For more information, see <a>Storage for the Root
--   Device</a>.
cs1DefaultRootDeviceType :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe RootDeviceType)

-- | A default Amazon EC2 key pair name. The default value is none. If you
--   specify a key pair name, AWS OpsWorks installs the public key on the
--   instance and you can use the private key with an SSH client to log in
--   to the instance. For more information, see <a>Using SSH to Communicate
--   with an Instance</a> and <a>Managing SSH Access</a>. You can override
--   this setting by specifying a different key pair, or no key pair, when
--   you <a>create an instance</a>.
cs1DefaultSshKeyName :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's default VPC subnet ID. This parameter is required if you
--   specify a value for the <tt>VpcId</tt> parameter. All instances are
--   launched into this subnet unless you specify otherwise when you create
--   the instance. If you also specify a value for
--   <tt>DefaultAvailabilityZone</tt>, the subnet must be in that zone. For
--   information on default values and when this parameter is required, see
--   the <tt>VpcId</tt> parameter description.
cs1DefaultSubnetId :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's host name theme, with spaces are replaced by underscores.
--   The theme is used to generate host names for the stack's instances. By
--   default, <tt>HostnameTheme</tt> is set to <tt>Layer_Dependent</tt>,
--   which creates host names by appending integers to the layer's short
--   name. The other themes are:
--   
--   <tt>Baked_Goods</tt> <tt>Clouds</tt> <tt>Europe_Cities</tt>
--   <tt>Fruits</tt> <tt>Greek_Deities</tt>
--   <tt>Legendary_creatures_from_Japan</tt> <tt>Planets_and_Moons</tt>
--   <tt>Roman_Deities</tt> <tt>Scottish_Islands</tt> <tt>US_Cities</tt>
--   <tt>Wild_Cats</tt> To obtain a generated host name, call
--   <tt>GetHostNameSuggestion</tt>, which returns a host name based on the
--   current theme.
cs1HostnameTheme :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The cloned stack name.
cs1Name :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The cloned stack AWS region, such as "us-east-1". For more information
--   about AWS regions, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
cs1Region :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role, which allows
--   AWS OpsWorks to work with AWS resources on your behalf. You must set
--   this parameter to the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an existing IAM
--   role. If you create a stack by using the AWS OpsWorks console, it
--   creates the role for you. You can obtain an existing stack's IAM ARN
--   programmatically by calling <tt>DescribePermissions</tt>. For more
--   information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   You must set this parameter to a valid service role ARN or the action
--   will fail; there is no default value. You can specify the source
--   stack's service role ARN, if you prefer, but you must do so
--   explicitly.
cs1ServiceRoleArn :: Lens' CloneStack Text

-- | The source stack ID.
cs1SourceStackId :: Lens' CloneStack Text

-- | Whether to use custom cookbooks.
cs1UseCustomCookbooks :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe Bool)

-- | Whether to associate the AWS OpsWorks built-in security groups with
--   the stack's layers.
--   
--   AWS OpsWorks provides a standard set of built-in security groups, one
--   for each layer, which are associated with layers by default. With
--   <tt>UseOpsworksSecurityGroups</tt> you can instead provide your own
--   custom security groups. <tt>UseOpsworksSecurityGroups</tt> has the
--   following settings:
--   
--   True - AWS OpsWorks automatically associates the appropriate built-in
--   security group with each layer (default setting). You can associate
--   additional security groups with a layer after you create it but you
--   cannot delete the built-in security group. False - AWS OpsWorks does
--   not associate built-in security groups with layers. You must create
--   appropriate EC2 security groups and associate a security group with
--   each layer that you create. However, you can still manually associate
--   a built-in security group with a layer on creation; custom security
--   groups are required only for those layers that need custom settings.
--   For more information, see <a>Create a NewStack</a>.
cs1UseOpsworksSecurityGroups :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ID of the VPC that the cloned stack is to be launched into. It
--   must be in the specified region. All instances are launched into this
--   VPC, and you cannot change the ID later.
--   
--   If your account supports EC2 Classic, the default value is no VPC. If
--   your account does not support EC2 Classic, the default value is the
--   default VPC for the specified region. If the VPC ID corresponds to a
--   default VPC and you have specified either the
--   <tt>DefaultAvailabilityZone</tt> or the <tt>DefaultSubnetId</tt>
--   parameter only, AWS OpsWorks infers the value of the other parameter.
--   If you specify neither parameter, AWS OpsWorks sets these parameters
--   to the first valid Availability Zone for the specified region and the
--   corresponding default VPC subnet ID, respectively.
--   
--   If you specify a nondefault VPC ID, note the following:
--   
--   It must belong to a VPC in your account that is in the specified
--   region. You must specify a value for <tt>DefaultSubnetId</tt>. For
--   more information on how to use AWS OpsWorks with a VPC, see <a>Running
--   a Stack in a VPC</a>. For more information on default VPC and EC2
--   Classic, see <a>Supported Platforms</a>.
cs1VpcId :: Lens' CloneStack (Maybe Text)
data CloneStackResponse

-- | <a>CloneStackResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>csrStackId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
cloneStackResponse :: CloneStackResponse

-- | The cloned stack ID.
csrStackId :: Lens' CloneStackResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CloneStack
instance Read CloneStack
instance Show CloneStack
instance Eq CloneStackResponse
instance Ord CloneStackResponse
instance Read CloneStackResponse
instance Show CloneStackResponse
instance Monoid CloneStackResponse
instance FromJSON CloneStackResponse
instance AWSRequest CloneStack
instance ToJSON CloneStack
instance ToHeaders CloneStack
instance ToQuery CloneStack
instance ToPath CloneStack


-- | Attaches an Elastic Load Balancing load balancer to a specified layer.
--   For more information, see <a>Elastic Load Balancing</a>.
--   
--   You must create the Elastic Load Balancing instance separately, by
--   using the Elastic Load Balancing console, API, or CLI. For more
--   information, see <a>Elastic Load Balancing Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_AttachElasticLoadBalancer.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.AttachElasticLoadBalancer
data AttachElasticLoadBalancer

-- | <a>AttachElasticLoadBalancer</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>aelbElasticLoadBalancerName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>aelbLayerId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
attachElasticLoadBalancer :: Text -> Text -> AttachElasticLoadBalancer

-- | The Elastic Load Balancing instance's name.
aelbElasticLoadBalancerName :: Lens' AttachElasticLoadBalancer Text

-- | The ID of the layer that the Elastic Load Balancing instance is to be
--   attached to.
aelbLayerId :: Lens' AttachElasticLoadBalancer Text
data AttachElasticLoadBalancerResponse

-- | <a>AttachElasticLoadBalancerResponse</a> constructor.
attachElasticLoadBalancerResponse :: AttachElasticLoadBalancerResponse
instance Eq AttachElasticLoadBalancer
instance Ord AttachElasticLoadBalancer
instance Read AttachElasticLoadBalancer
instance Show AttachElasticLoadBalancer
instance Eq AttachElasticLoadBalancerResponse
instance Ord AttachElasticLoadBalancerResponse
instance Read AttachElasticLoadBalancerResponse
instance Show AttachElasticLoadBalancerResponse
instance Generic AttachElasticLoadBalancerResponse
instance Datatype D1AttachElasticLoadBalancerResponse
instance Constructor C1_0AttachElasticLoadBalancerResponse
instance AWSRequest AttachElasticLoadBalancer
instance ToJSON AttachElasticLoadBalancer
instance ToHeaders AttachElasticLoadBalancer
instance ToQuery AttachElasticLoadBalancer
instance ToPath AttachElasticLoadBalancer


-- | Associates one of the stack's registered Elastic IP addresses with a
--   specified instance. The address must first be registered with the
--   stack by calling <tt>RegisterElasticIp</tt>. For more information, see
--   <a>Resource Management</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_AssociateElasticIp.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.AssociateElasticIp
data AssociateElasticIp

-- | <a>AssociateElasticIp</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>aeiElasticIp</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>aeiInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
associateElasticIp :: Text -> AssociateElasticIp

-- | The Elastic IP address.
aeiElasticIp :: Lens' AssociateElasticIp Text

-- | The instance ID.
aeiInstanceId :: Lens' AssociateElasticIp (Maybe Text)
data AssociateElasticIpResponse

-- | <a>AssociateElasticIpResponse</a> constructor.
associateElasticIpResponse :: AssociateElasticIpResponse
instance Eq AssociateElasticIp
instance Ord AssociateElasticIp
instance Read AssociateElasticIp
instance Show AssociateElasticIp
instance Eq AssociateElasticIpResponse
instance Ord AssociateElasticIpResponse
instance Read AssociateElasticIpResponse
instance Show AssociateElasticIpResponse
instance Generic AssociateElasticIpResponse
instance Datatype D1AssociateElasticIpResponse
instance Constructor C1_0AssociateElasticIpResponse
instance AWSRequest AssociateElasticIp
instance ToJSON AssociateElasticIp
instance ToHeaders AssociateElasticIp
instance ToQuery AssociateElasticIp
instance ToPath AssociateElasticIp


-- | Assigns one of the stack's registered Amazon EBS volumes to a
--   specified instance. The volume must first be registered with the stack
--   by calling <tt>RegisterVolume</tt>. After you register the volume, you
--   must call <tt>UpdateVolume</tt> to specify a mount point before
--   calling <a>AssignVolume</a>. For more information, see
--   <a>ResourceManagement</a>.
--   
--   Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a
--   Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing UserPermissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_AssignVolume.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.AssignVolume
data AssignVolume

-- | <a>AssignVolume</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>avInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>avVolumeId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
assignVolume :: Text -> AssignVolume

-- | The instance ID.
avInstanceId :: Lens' AssignVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume ID.
avVolumeId :: Lens' AssignVolume Text
data AssignVolumeResponse

-- | <a>AssignVolumeResponse</a> constructor.
assignVolumeResponse :: AssignVolumeResponse
instance Eq AssignVolume
instance Ord AssignVolume
instance Read AssignVolume
instance Show AssignVolume
instance Eq AssignVolumeResponse
instance Ord AssignVolumeResponse
instance Read AssignVolumeResponse
instance Show AssignVolumeResponse
instance Generic AssignVolumeResponse
instance Datatype D1AssignVolumeResponse
instance Constructor C1_0AssignVolumeResponse
instance AWSRequest AssignVolume
instance ToJSON AssignVolume
instance ToHeaders AssignVolume
instance ToQuery AssignVolume
instance ToPath AssignVolume


-- | Assign a registered instance to a layer.
--   
--   You can assign registered on-premises instances to any layer type. You
--   can assign registered Amazon EC2 instances only to custom layers. You
--   cannot use this action with instances that were created with AWS
--   OpsWorks. Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must
--   have a Manage permissions level for the stack or an attached policy
--   that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/APIReference/API_AssignInstance.html</a>
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.AssignInstance
data AssignInstance

-- | <a>AssignInstance</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>aiInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>aiLayerIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
assignInstance :: Text -> AssignInstance

-- | The instance ID.
aiInstanceId :: Lens' AssignInstance Text

-- | The layer ID, which must correspond to a custom layer. You cannot
--   assign a registered instance to a built-in layer.
aiLayerIds :: Lens' AssignInstance [Text]
data AssignInstanceResponse

-- | <a>AssignInstanceResponse</a> constructor.
assignInstanceResponse :: AssignInstanceResponse
instance Eq AssignInstance
instance Ord AssignInstance
instance Read AssignInstance
instance Show AssignInstance
instance Eq AssignInstanceResponse
instance Ord AssignInstanceResponse
instance Read AssignInstanceResponse
instance Show AssignInstanceResponse
instance Generic AssignInstanceResponse
instance Datatype D1AssignInstanceResponse
instance Constructor C1_0AssignInstanceResponse
instance AWSRequest AssignInstance
instance ToJSON AssignInstance
instance ToHeaders AssignInstance
instance ToQuery AssignInstance
instance ToPath AssignInstance


-- | AWS OpsWorks provides a simple and flexible way to create and manage
--   stacks and applications. With AWS OpsWorks, you can provision AWS
--   resources, manage their configuration, deploy applications to those
--   resources, and monitor their health.
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks
